reviews.review: Al Maha Desert Resort. As a desert conservation area this was exceptional. The large area is enclosed and Arabian Oryx, Arabian Gazelle and Sand Gazelle have been introduced and they are increasing. The first two are easily seen during the cooler parts of the day. The temperature during the day reached 44 degrees. Facilities included guided walks, safaris, hair raising dune drives outside the conservation area and falconry. The restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful. The evening meal from a wide menu was five courses. The suites were scattered in the shrub lined dunes. Suites one and two are quite a distance from the restaurant but just telephone for a buggy and it soon arrives. Suite to accommodates at least five people. The suite is air conditioned, cleaned every day and the beds are made up whilst you take your evening meal. There is a small swimming pool at the front and birds and animals come for a drink if the surroundings are quiet.

Nature! In Dubai! How incredible!. In the midst of this man-made city in the sand-pit, who knew there'd be a wild life conservatory!I'd been to the desert before, but I didn't know I'd been tot he Red Desert, which has brilliant red sand but no signs of life.In the conservatory, the sand is a dull tan color but there are animals in exchange! I saw little gazelle, ibex, goats, camel, sand lizards, snakes, and even little bugs.Go here on a desert safari with your kids and have a great time seeing what little wild life and nature that Dubai has.
Dubai Desert. Had a wonderful evening seeing the wildlife, dune bashing, enjoying the sunset and a wonderful dinner at the Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve. Definitely recommended!

Must see in UAE. This is a great experience to see desert before sunset. Drivers will give you adrenaline, as they are driving very fast through desert. In the evening you will have dinner and ride camel.
Very Good. Its a very good experience. Riding a camel on the desert, watching falcon, different type of dances, sunset, etc.
great place. It is a must do to go on a Safari through this reserve. so many tours go here and it is nice to visit afternoon and see the amazing sunset.
Sand bashing!. Make sure your driver is an experienced one. Newbies don't drive fast, that takes away the edge from the sand-bashing experience!
wow. Best experience that i have had in dubai till now because the cars that were use for us were extremly good.

A safari adventure you would not want to miss. The 4x4 wheel drive on the sand dunes was amazing, the Falcon show was interestingthe Sunset amazing,then the food & Drink, the camel ride was great and the foot awesomethe Bellydancer was enchantinga must do

4x4 Adventure with dinner and a show. Arabian adventures took us out to the dessert and went crazy over the sand dunes in the 4x4 s then a Falcon show and a camel ride then to a traditional dinner under the stars. It was awesome.

Exciting trip into desert. We were picked up and taken for a red dune bashing experience. Our driver was very experienced and took us on quite an exciting journey over the dunes. My heart was racing but it was a trip I would highly recommend. The sunset is lovely and the dunes are spectacular

good fun. Desert safari was always on my bucket list and overall i would give this activity 4/5. If you like dune bashing this is the thing for you but it also gives you headache and nausea. Eat light and drink lots of water.
Dubai Desert. The Desert is very safe, beautiful and for families and even kids as well. My husband and kids really enjoyed our safari ride.
Much better desert experience than Riyadh!. The hills are much steeper and the sand is more cleaner compared to Riyadh's Red Sand. It is a nice place to watch sunset too!

Go of the Arabian adventure on wheels!. This is a great adventure. Prior to the start you will stop from restroom and snacks. You can even do an ATV ride. Then it starts...hold on to your seatbelt and the seat in front of you. A girlfriend of mine on the trip took her "Dramanine Treatment" 12 hours before, the afternoon and right before. She was so right, if you get motion sickness take the drug! I was in a car with someone who got really sick and it was rough. At the end you will complete the tour with a true arabian desert meal complete with entertainment and henna tattooing if that's what you want. This was truly enjoyable. :)
A Must. we did this trip and it was fab the food was very good we had great fun on the quad bikes as well they really look after you

Dune Bashing. We went with Arabian Adventures, the trip was brilliant, they have their own camp at the end of the dune bashing, camel rides, henna and the food was nice. Our driver was Masood. Would definitely recommend this company.
Once go and experience it. Cultural Place of Dubai and it has great experience. Desert dance and camel ride is awesome and amazing sunset view also.

A wonderful Experience.. We started from the hotel.. stopped in midway for quad biking which was great fun. Then started the real fun of dune dashing..it was great..cant put in words. Later went to camp where dance, tanoora show etc.. the food was disappointing (which I was told earlier also)

What a cultural thrill!. This was an amazing adventure, the journey was interesting, the destination was spectacular. The 4WD dune adventure was totally thrilling. Plus watching the sunset over the sandy desert was so amazing! We recommend this adventure to all - children and adults. Note: wear good shoes - ones that you can shake sand from easily. The sand is hot and surprisingly soft. Exciting!

Mustt Go ....... If you are anyway in UAE this is a must experience ...
Your own roller coaster on sand ....Amazingly amazing

Tour with Knights adventure. Had a great couple of hours doing the desert safari - great sand dunes and really exciting
Well organised and safe
I recommend Knights who had great cars and fantastic drivers

The best tour ever!. My trip to the dessert will be unforgettable! Arabian adventure made this day so so special! Ayaz our guide was so warm and well educated, he also made us feel comfortable and made his best for us to enjoy every minute of our day! The dessert tour started with a Falcon show and camel photos then we had a 45 minute ride of the dessert with amazing views and beautiful sceneries to take awesome pictures which will remain in the memories forever. After that we went to a Camp that they have settled in the dessert OMG what an impressive place, they have hookah, camel rides, the best dinner, henna, belly dancing show... You name it they got it! Arabic Adventures focuses on quality and service which is what I felt from the moment I hopped in the car!

Peaceful. This desert safari provided by Arabian Adventures, was amazing. You got a lot for the price! Pick up from hotel, hawk show, desert ride in SUV, pictures taken in desert sunset. Then your last stop is a oasis in the desert with Bbq, drinks, henna, hookah, belly dancers, and star gazing. Last but definitely not least CAMELS RIDES! Will do it again!

ADVENTURE OF DESERT SAFARI. All the tourists who visit DUBAI have to take desert safari ride adventure. We have booked tour of RAYNA TOURS AND TRAVELS. We got fully adventure in DESERT SAFARI. Our Driver Mr. Bilal alias Sunny was a excellent driver who had good command over steering. We enjoyed very much.
wonderful day. Osman was professional driver in desert and would like to stay long time. my family enjoyed with sunset view.

we enjoyed dune bashing .. once more ... we enjoyed this activity if you are in emirates plz go for desert safari. service was very prompt . our hotel staff booked this for us . that land cruiser is specially maintained for dessert safari they had fixed few pipes. we love dune bashing, Arabic dance , food drinks. they have other activities in there camp side like quad bike ride, camel ride hukka , and other activities . my driver was very friendly and funny.I love desert safari activity.

Desert Safari. This was the highlight of the trip and must visit kind of thing in your list. At times it was scary going up and down the Dunnes but it was so much of fun.The tour was bit expensive for a family of four and at the end of day it was worth every penny. In the evening, the belly dance show was beautiful in the middle of desert.Will visit again.

The Highlight of our Trip. Don't miss the Desert Safari tour when you visit Dubai.It includes ATV (Optional), Dune Bashing, Camel Riding, Shisha smoking, Henna, Costume Photo ops, Belly Dancing, Tanoura Dancing and buffet dinner of great local foods.Don't miss the ATV driving in the real orange colored desert. It was fun and thrilling. Dune bashing is like a roller coaster ride. Nausea warning though specially on kids. Bedouin Camp which is in the middle of the desert have good sound and light system. Stage is located in the middle of the camp and all visitors are gathered around it.Overall it was the highlight of our visit to Dubai.

Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve. This by far was a top venue we enjoyed. The experience of the desert, wildlife, falcon demonstration, camel ride, dinner and heritage will make you appreciate it all.
Excellent outdoor activity in Dubai. The quad bike in the dessert, the dressing local, the sundown, the dinner and the belly dancing just made our evening. A must do in Dubai

Make sure to use sun block and take sun glasses.. Another must -do in Dubai. Just note if you have joint or back problems then this would most probable be unsuitable. The land-rover drivers are very skilled and it is a smooth ride but the camel ride is not as comfortable. But if you can bear the bumpy ride then do not miss this fantastic day out. I love the fact that it is very safe to venture out as a girls only group or single parent family. Just use common sense!

Great outing into the desert. We did the conservation drive and it was simply wonderful. We were able to see some arabian deers and a herd of oryx as well as some birds. Our guide Paulo was superb; friendly, informative and knowledgable. He showed us some great places to take photographs and the breakfast at the Al Maha resort was scrumptious! The conservation area is huge and it is lovely that such a vast space has been dedicated to preserving the flora and fauna. We can definitely recommend this trip and will be doing it again the next time we are here.

Great dune and camel ride. It was by far the best thing to do in Dubai.The dune ride with the car was just fun pure, amazing as so was the camel ride.The reserve is lovely but after a while you have seen everything and its getting a bit boring while waiting for dinner.At least it has a bar where you can have some alcoholic drinks as well.The dinner is okay. It has a huge range of different meals but its not my taste, so I did not really like it.The entertainment was nice but I expected a bit more or different or both.Overall, its really a great experience but in my opinion, it is too much touristy.

dessert safari. groupon voucher trip, dune bashing fun a little scary, camel rides, hold bird of prey, sand boarding, and quads at small extra charge then traditional meal in camp and entertainment, belly dancer, turine dancer and fire dancer. henna tattoo, good fun

A camel ride into the sunset. This was the highlight of a five week trip through Europe and then on to Dubai. The trip into the desert. followed by the 45 minute camel ride and then an enormous meal in a desert compound was outstanding. Highly recommend this to anyone

AN ABSOLUTE MUST DO. A definite highlight of the trip. Our guide was informative and friendly, the sand dune experience was thrilling and had the opportunity to get out of the car and take beautiful photos in the desert. Then, at the conservation reserve, the food was delicious and plentiful and the entertainment was excellent; belly dancer, henna, shisha, camel rides just to name a few. Arabic coffee and dates were served upon entry which was a pleasant highlight of the evening. Cannot recommend this enough, it is simply a must do. Also value for money - such a long tour (almost 6 hours) with food and drink included, as well as constant entertainment!! One word of warning though - if you are a contact wearer, DO NOT WEAR YOUR CONTACTS!! The desert sand irritated my eyes and I was not wearing my contacts, cannot imagine how irritated my eyes would have been was I wearing contacts.

Worth to visit. I visited there many times part of the desert safari. This area is very well maintained and worth to see and experience the dune bashing. Also you can see some wild animals normal seen Arabian deserts.

Great experience . Loved dune basing and the desert sunset. Ended with a really good BBQ meal in the middle of the desert, was actually surprised at how good the food was. A great experience all round!
GREAT. It's one of my best experience in town. It should definetely be checked. The cars are new and the experince was soooo great.

Great Guide Great 4x4, food and entertainment.. Our guide Arafat arrived at our hotel for a guided evening of entertainment which included 4x4 sand sand dunes, eagle show, belly dancing show, food and drink, camel rides, and henna. You couldnt ask for more!!!Arafat was kind and patient with all our questions and gave really good information on all the places we past when we left the city centre. I believe he has been doing these tours for a long time and he is definitely professional, knowledgeable and very very good at his job!The whole evening flew by so we didn't get the opportunity to do everything. This was a gift from my new husband for my birthday and it couldn't have been any better. There were about 60 cars in total and about 6 people per car. The whole thing was extremely well organised with all cars stopping at several points for the pictures with well organised timing and precision. Would do it again....

Awesome adventurous trip. Dubai Desert Safari is one of the most awesome and unforgettable trip. The service was too good. I was picked up from my hotel and dropped in the same jeep. The driver was brilliant. I enjoyed camel safari plus bbq dinner and belly dance. Overall perfect trip.
A lot of fun, bit touristy. Fun day in the desert dunes. Usually followed by Arabian tourist stuff: BBQ, henna tattoo, belly dancing, dance twirling, camel rides etc.
Dinner by under the Arabian Stars. We used Arabian Adventures as the tour and wished there were more variety of food and our camel rides a bit longer rather than just a couple of metres.
Amazing. What an adventure!!! The car ride on the safari was unbelievable. A little scary driving on a small strip of sand. Over all it was awesome.

WHITE ARABIAN ORYX. Go and see the white Arabian Oryx up close and personal and then treat yourself to a night of luxury at the Al Maha Desert Resort, a completely majestic hideaway on the Dubai - Al Ain road.

Sunset Desert Safari. Wow! what a worthwhile trip this turned out to be. It's a must if you are visiting Dubai. I was picked up at my hotel at 4.30pm along with some others and driven to the Dubai Desert Conservation reserve for my Camel ride into the desert to witness a great Falcon show and very informative talk, then onto a beautiful oasis to feast on a abundance of food which was cooked to perfection. Watched some dancing, got a Henna Tattoo followed by a talk on the stars/solar system (optional) then relaxation on ground carpets and optional smoking pipes. After a lovely evening a Jeep ride back to the pick up car and back to Hotel around 10.30pm. Excellent trip for everyone.

Desrt Safari - No one can miss. This is the place where you will enjoy the most peace and calm, if you have already spent good time in Dubai Malls and Entertainment parks, our ride was for 45 minutes in 4X4 vehicle the SUV was going ups/downs on dunes where you could see how the vehicle in front of you is skidding on sands, sometime it thrilling otherwise this was joyful ride. any age person can do this, this dosnt require age to enjoy, my father in law who is 76 years old enjoyed this with me.after this 45 minutes of sand dunes, our vehicle took us to the camp, where we were served food (veg and non veg) both options available along with unlimited Soft Drinks and Water, but if you want to try liquor then you need pay separately. during food there were dance performances. Apart from food and performances you can try Seesha (Hukha), Mehandi (Heena), camel ride, a photo with Eagle, Liquor (Paid), Quad ride, we did this tour through "Rayna Tours and Travels" and they organised it well. Driver "Gaffur" (if not forgot his name by now) was really good and informative.

A true Desert experience with the know how. Beside all the excitement and trill of the Desert Safari, the Reserve provide a more in depth knowledge and a different sight of the desert. We join the Platinum Heritage tour and spend most of the ride along side the Reserve.If you are lucky, you will encounter quite a various of animals living here.It is highly recommend to ride on open top vintage Land Rover to maximize the experience.
Sand Bashing. Excellent Sand Bashing and sand surfing.We also did quad biking- Don't wear flip flops the sand is very very hot. Trainers and socks a better option.

BEST Dessert Sand Dune riding experience. If you are in Dubai and have finished visiting the sky-scrapper and mall filed tourist attractions, ensure heading out to the Dubai Desert. There are multiple agencies organizing trips to the desert conservation reserve. A typical tour consists of the following:1. Ride to the desert conservation reserve from your doorstep.2. An exciting sand dune riding experience in your SUV en-route to a camp. Nothing beats this experience.3. Our camp had entertainment like dance performances and you could get hookah, ride a camel/horse and also rent an ATV bike to ride the sand dunes.4. They also have food options throughout.5. After enjoying a day amidst the desert, you get a ride back to your home.Overall a must do experience, being in the middle of a desert. We were far away from any civilization. Ensure you choose a reputed tour group for the best experience.
WOW.... The trip was amazing!!! we had wonderful time and driver is outstanding (Mr. Irufan). The buffet dinner bit spicy and the dancing was superb...

Safari Desert. This was so much fun and worth the money. Riding trucks in sand, camel rides, sand skiing. Dinner and belly dancing was great. Need to bring cash for quads. We did not. It was an amazing day
Simply beautiful. one of the most wonder attraction in Dubai, its a great place for a tour to discover the wonder of the Arabian Desert.

Great Adventure in the Sand Dunes. We did an inexpensive (about $45/pp) tour that involved driving over the dunes in roller coaster fashion, then dinner in a "Bedouin" camp. Had to put quotes around that because it was a stationary tourist camp (Bedouin's are nomadic). Still had a great dinner and entertainment with belly dancers and a nice traditional male dancer. Great experience.

Everyone must experience at least once in a lifetime !!!. Toyota Cruiser wehicle by chauffer comes and pick you from your address on time. Adventure takes around 7 hours. You share the car by other people. Dune bashing, camel and ATV riding are not include the price. Hena tatoo, dinner soft drinks, shisha and dance performs are included the package price.Prices are very flexible. Make a good bargain and do not let hotel staff earn commission over your trip fare.Enjoy!
Best tour i ever got!. Place is amazing, drivers are carefull, dunes are orange color its an amazing view. Two shows while sitting, camells, hena tatto, hooka and all its free
Fascinating. The Desert Safari and dinner was a nice introduction to the mystries of Arabia. It was fun and the shows were original

Not to be missed on a trip to Dubai. We went with a jeep safari company owned by Emirates airlines. This was a superb evening. Picked up at our hotel at 4pm and returned at 11pm ish. Just google this to see what is on offer. You get exactly what is offered and all aspects of the safari are excellent and extremely well organised. You are part of a very large group, but this does not dtract, infact it adds atmosphere to the evening meal part of the trip.
Fantastic Desert!. oh... the desert is fantastic! Can't wait to visit Desert on sunset)) Very recommend to visit it!!!!

An amazing experience - one of its kind. Have done this multiple times, and never tire of the same.
This is a one-of-its-kind experience and a must-do during your visit to Dubai.
Take a pick of any of the providers. But ensure that you do extra due-diligence and you can find a very good deal!!!

Roller coster ride in 4x4. Usually they take you at the desert in 4x4 suv's. The ride is breath taking. The loud music, the ups and downs in your land cruiser is sure to make your day at desert safari. But the belly dance, the sheesa and especially the food is worst. If you are a sheesa lover then they are sure to disappoint you. It will choke the hell outta your threat with its red hot base. The buffet has both veg and non veg. But it will taste like as if it was prepared days back and was preserved to serve you now.

Best experience!. Take the tour! It`s a great experience when you visit Dubai! Take notice that I don`t recomand it on summer.. it`s too hot outside. Made it on winter! Take a vip tour.. it`s not that expensive and it will worth every penny!

A brilliant idea. My friend and I did a tour here with Emirates Holidays and loved it. It is a beautiful place and very quiet. The wildlife is varied and the guides know the area and the species well. I found this much better than the typical desert safari tours offered as you learn more about the history of the species and what is being done to conserve them.

Unique experience of car riding in the desert. This is awesome experience which cannot be explained in words. Driving in desert dunes require special skill. You enjoy riding in desert which you should not miss it. After riding they take you for sun set and camel riding. After all these you will have a dinner and belly dancing. All together this is lifelong remembrance.
WOW. Excellent safari with relaxing meal and shisha. i learned from our driver new things cause i had safari with my own car but with them it was excellent experience .
Spectacular. I booked the dessert safari with Platinum Heritage group. It was an amazing experience and the staff members of Platinum Heritage are great. Don´t miss it.
Fun. We thought it was real fun to do the dune bashing,adrenalin is pumping because you think the car is going to turn over anytime.The desert is magical. Sunset,camels,food and entertainment.
The visit is worth the trip to Dubai. It was a very deep experience in spite of the hot weather everything was simply perfect and well organized

take care of every thing. The Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve (DDCR) is the UAE’s first national park. Carefully planned rehabilitation over the years has resulted in a protected environment for the last of the desert wildernesses. With the rapid development of Dubai as a major business centre in the Gulf, the Dubai Government has long recognised the need to preserve its unique and beautiful desert habitat, and the many threatened flora and fauna species within. This unique reserve was created for the protection of those endangered species and for the conservation of the natural desert habitat and heritage.

Preserving Desert Plants and Fauna. This tour was part a bigger adventure not in the Conservation Area. We have been efforts to plant areas of native plants and trees like palms and native grasses. Not only do they seem to stabilize dune areas but the shade provides a welcome rest point for some animals yes some animals are found to the area.

Sandduning with Arabian Advertures. What an exhilarating experience! Our driver was excellent and made the experience exceptional. The dinner/bazaar following was very enjoyable, and the falcon flying exhibition was very educational.

Wildlife and sand dunes. We did this reserve with a tour, great playground,
Animals and sand dunes we did a 4x4 ride was fabulous,
Also oasis was great place to see falcon in flight
Very hot, a must see while in Dubai!. Dress accordingly, wear sneakers and bring a hat! Make sure you have a camera handy! Lot's of beautiful scenery.

the best if in Dubai. the best experience for me and my wife in Dubai... the bike experience on the sand.. the land cruiser dune bashing... the sunset.. the camp site barbeque dinner.. the cultural dances and belly dance performed at the camp site.. it is just an awesome experience, irrespective of the area you belong to on this world.. you will love it..
Tour Dubai!. the landscape is very beautiful! there are a lot of companies that did this tour, pick up and dropp in the hotel.

Fun thing to do during one day. One day activity, they pick you up from the hotel in the afternoon around 16:30, since we were there during the summer they go later because of the sun and the heat, and the drive was about 45 minutes to the reservation from Dubai centre. The cars are really good and big so there is enough room and the ride was special. Really gumpy and hot, a lot of people had to take breaks due to nasuea but it was fun. Didnt go that fast tho and the drivers could be more aggressive in their driving but still it was a experience. In the evening they stopped at a big tent were we could sand board (not worth it unless you like soar muscles from running in sand) camel riding, holding falcons, barbeque, shisha, henna and belly dancing. It wss a nice evening and I would recommend you to try this.
Must. Its a must do when in Dubai .Desert safari is unique its own ways and you can truly experience the Desert ... The camp ,the Hookah ,camel ride etc everything was great ...

awesome!. you go to the dunes on a 4 wheel drive. the driver was very good and knowledgeable. Is very important that you take something for motion sickness because the ride on the dunes is very radical. you stop to see a beautiful sunset before going for a fun Camel ride and a meal on the desert, very interesting, there was also a show of belly dancing. I really enjoyed!!!
good...but not perfect. my personal experience was not so good, just ok...you will do everything like camel ride, hukkah , buffet but everything in very low quantity.
Enjoyable trip. We went into the reserve in a 4 wheel drive. The guide was knowledgeable and ensured that we enjoyed ourselves in the sand. The trip also included a meal and drinks which was fun
Woow. Superb, being in the car on the dunes and after in the middle of nowhere only you and wind, really nice time also on the camp. Highly recommend !!!
stunning. A real insight into the lives of the history of the Emirati people. The area has a fantastic history and culture far removed from modern day Dubai. A real gem.
Good time. Been to desert safari in Dubai. With quad biking, Dune bashing, and Belly Dance etc. Nice evening to spent on these activities in desert safari.
Enjoyed by all. A special evening.. Loved the jeep ride over the sand dunes, the visit to the Bedouin village and plentiful local food. Do try the camel ride under the stars - felt like Christmas!
Peace and serenity in Dubai. I visited the DDCR with a guided tour from Arabian Adventures - well recommended for a visit for sunset shots, shisha, and an experience duning!

Wonderful Experience. A must do.. We did a trip to to the desert in a four wheel drive Toyota Safari. I paid a little extra and we had the car to our selves. we really had a great time. Our driver was excellent and really knew what we was doing. He really knew how to handle the sand dunes and took us to a couple of spots that were quite deserted. It can get quite busy out there with other vechiles so this was not an easy task. I think that this experience is must for any visit to Dubai. We then had dinner at a desert resort after this with great food and entertainment but for me the highlight was the four wheel driving in the desert sand dunes.

Must go!!. Had an evening here with Arabian Adventures. The reserve is clean and the sand is lush and unspoilt. Where ever we stopped in the reserve the sand was beatiful and it felt untouched by anyone. Local animals stroll around in the distance. Lovely place and well protected.

The best tour ever. They pick us up at the hotel at 4 pm with the luxury tour privat car 5 people and once we arrive to the reserve we move into a 60 jeep great tout and well explained. We finish the tout in a Bedouin village with belly dancing and lots local grill coked food that included camel meet stew and lots of other local food. It was great.

A must visit when in Dubai. You can go to alot of cities around the world and they all have skyscrappers and shopping mals. How many cities have a desert so close that you can actually tour and even spend the night. Excellent experience

Great desert day out. The main attraction are the white Oryx which are cared for by the government. The site of coming across the herd on your desert safari is really impressive. There are lots of little gazelles bouncing and running around and on our last visit we saw vultures and lizards too. The drivers are all safe and speak English and are well informed about the environment and you can book for desert barbeques which they can set up for you at nightfall. Don't do this between May and Septembeber it is simply too hot but when the weather cools a bit this desert adventure can be very rewarding

don't go for Safari. well if you go to dubai as a tourist you might be interested to go in a tour to the desert, it is a very nice idea, but avoid to go on Safari paid trip, you can rent a 4+4 car and enjoy a trip by urself but sure u need to know how to surf in desert and have all the needed thing for all situations... go with friends to Alkhawaneej take ur drinks or food and table with chairs and enjoy the night, there are places for camping also you can use them,,, personally I prefer going with friends and be free than paying money to eat cold food or go wherever they want me to go...

A desert experience filled with terrible times. Not only is getting to the place alive a challenge but the disorganised racing around of cars with ridiculously loud head banger music leaves one numb. The amount of trash in the desert is sad to see.

Dancing with the Sands. All you need is water, your camera and light sporty attire to enjoy comfortably the wide paradise of beautiful desert. Better take a ride and feel free to go as far as you can, be refreshed and feel re-energized after.

Stunning Scenery. Stunning scenery.This nature reserve is beautiful.We saw lots of the animals are hat live on the nature reserve and our guide AD Bhatti was very good at spotting and pointing out these animals.

Great place to visit. finally got a chance to visit the desert...this place was nice and I even got a chance to ride a camel for the first time...The sand was soft and the wind was breezy...This is a must do if you are ever in Dubai!!
The beauty of the natural world of UAE. This is where the country came from so make sure you see the real world of history that we make the change from. Nature is to be respected.
Dinner in the desert. This is a must do trip. Highly entertaining and enjoyable. Felt at times like we were the only people out there.
good to see desert. you can feel desert is what during the 4 wheels car to driving at sand.you can not imagein the feeling but you can feel after this tour.

Dessert Safari. Desert Safari a popular destination for action and adventure in Toyota Land Cruiser. When we reached the dessert area the drivers lower the tyre pressure to make the sand driving easier, we had 40 minute tour of the sand dunes at high speed, usually driving up them and sliding down them sideways over sand dunes, it was really a thrilling experience after the Dune Bashing, we took a halt in a Camp located at mid of dessert where we experienced Camel Ride, Sand Boarding, Heena Painting, Belly dancing, Tanoura show , Fire Show, ATV bike rides & BBQ Dinner, here I got a chance to wear Arabic costume Kandura (long white cloak) and Guthra (headscarf) & Agal (black cord which is fastened around the head)
Breath Taking Sun Set. Went on desert experience trip and bbq with belly dancers. Was very enjoyable and the desert is beautiful. Would highly recommend.

I had the luck to live from 2009 to 2012 (3 years) inmid of the Rub Al Khali desert.... I read a lot of articles and books about the Rub Al Khali desert, the largest desert of Arabia. I was fascinated of this phenomenal desert!I had the luck of my life to land a job just inmid of the Rub Al Khali desert, in a small town 170 km southwest of Abu Dhabi City.I didn't buy a 4-wheels drive jeep, but a very beautiful Lexus convertible car. Yes, a convertible car! Driving with open roof is a fun in the sunny winter in the Arabian Emirates. I enjoyed my wonderful car and the excellent roads in the Emirates. I drove 135.000 (!!) km in 2 1/2 years. The best time in the Emirates is from October to March; the summer is terrible hot and the climate in Abu Dhabi CIty and in Dubai city is terrible humid, because of the evaporization of the water in the Arabian Gulf. Definitely a "MUST" in the Emirates is a 4-wheels drive trip into the desert! You will never forget this phtantastic experience of a drive into the desert.

Arabian nights. An amazing experience to the desert, driving up and down the sand dunes was exciting, although some may become sick from the up and down motions. The first stop, the bird show was least impressive, but we took great pictures at sun down and dining under the star was amazing, live shows vary depending on season.... great food, unlimited wine and beers.. .Highly recommended!

Dune Bashing and Belly Dance. If you are going outing in Dubai and do not go for Desert Safari, you have missed some thing.Here is the trip advice and experience for you.When you travel there go in a team of 4 or more. So that the package will be less costly and can be shared. Carry some snacks with you for time pass on travel or during belly dance.The price of desert safari starts around 60AED per person. There will be other price also but 60 AED is worth it. You will need to travel to the spot on your own or with a tour package. The cost usually includes the Dune bashing , Camel ride and belly dance. A high cost ticket gives you a luxurious SUV like hammer. But dont worry even least you will get Land cruiser with the starting price. It will be a roller coaster ride and you will love it. It is totally safe and exciting. in evening you will have to watch belly dance and tamura dance or even a magic show. This is an hour or little more event followed by dinner buffet.Contact your tourist for a sky diving price in case if you are willing to afford.
Good. Still a bit of a work in progress but worth a visit if you have the transport as it is about half an hour outside Dubai.Nice water features and birdlife.

Very Good!. The best way to enjoy one of the biggest desert on earth at only 45 minutes from your hotel. Great experience on sunset including dune driving, falconry, dinner in camp, stars observatory... It is a must!

If you do nothing else, do this excursion. This was a great experience and is a definite MUST DO when visiting the desert, especially if this is your first time here. The drivers are pros! Don't worry at all. Just relax and have a good time.The Russian dancers were ok, but if you are attending a Middle Eastern buffet with a belly dancer, do you really want to see a Russian girl attempting to look "Arabic" as your dancer?

Lovely experience. We chose to do the tour in the enclosed Mercedes SUV, but you can also do it in one of the big open top vehicles...I live here, so I've had my fill of dust, sand and blazing sun.First they tie your headscarf on, which is a cool if touristy little touch. Then we went to see the falconer. The one the day we were there was a lovely South African lady who really knows her stuff. You get a chance to actually get up close and personal with three different breeds of falcons, which she will handle and feed while she tells you all about the fascinating history of the falcon in the UAE. I knew falcons were important here, but I never really understood why or how they were used until this trip. Very informative. The highlight of this portion of the visit to me was the owl that this handler had with her. What an amazingly beautiful bird!Then we went to a different area for a short camel ride. I've ridden camels before and it's always a fun thing to do. Both of us that were on this trip are horse people. But if you think riding a camel is anything like riding a horse, think again! It is a really different experience! The camels themselves are really gorgeous animals...very stoic and regal and simply HUGE!They then took us to a "majlis"-type area and gave us a snack and cold drink (or coffee, your choice), which was a nice touch. Then you drove out into the dunes to search for the Oryx. We saw several of them, as well as a small Arabian deer.Overall a nice way to spend an afternoon and well worth the trip.

Radical safari at Dubai desert. We decide to do a safari radical on desert,I found, loads of garbage all over, people do not respect the environment, and authorities, should keep the tourist area around Dubai, as clean as Dubai city.Apart of that We enjoy the rally, and we had dinner somewhere, but excellent food Quality. I suggest to all tourists to do it.

Desert safari. Simply awesome. Here I need to pen in a few words regarding our tour guide "Faisal Khan". What an expert driver he is on sand dunes. Gave us a thrill of our lives with his expert driving over the dunes while at the same time keeping us in laughters all throughout. Such a nice soul. I wish to add here a special mention the way he handled the car once when it got stuck on the dunes at an very awkward angle. Imagine he is Persuing his MBA at the same time and taking care of his family. I highly recommend him guys when your doing a desert safari there. You can pickup his details from J W Marriott marquis who I also thank for putting us with him. God bless him and his family.
Brillient. Totally worth a visit - don't miss going for one of the Safari and Dinner experiences...it's magical.

A must go!. It was an amazing experience to see the desert in Dubai. It doesn't compare to Egypt but it's great. Specially to take some cool photos.
I didn't appreciate the way they treat the camels or the falcon. Also I didn't stay for dinner, Eating camel is not something I'm looking forward to do.

Woo hoo!!!!!. This was my second time o the Desert Safari and it was just as exciting! The driver was very good and although we spent most of the time teasing my colleague who was petrified, we all managed to enjoy it too. We were there in Ramaddan so we didn't get to see the belly dancers, but the tanoura and another dancer with LED lights on his skirts were very good. Worth it! Plus, I got a camel ride too.

Sun, sand and food. An exciting afternoon and evening. A 4wd trip through the desert witness plenty of up and downhill action. A lovely stop at the top of a sand dune to watch the sunset into the desert. A great dinner at a tent camp with plenty to eat and a good choice of food.
Fantastic day out. A must if you are in the area, fantastic place to visit and experience. All the family enjoyed the desert safari.

A sea of sand. The place is incredible, mainly for those that haven't had many contacts with desert. It's very big and the sand seems to merge with the sky at the horizon in all the directions you look.The drawback is that there are a large number of cars making Safaris (I was also inside one) and so you don't have a place that you can get out, have seat and enjoy safely and the place where the Safari stops is not so beautiful.
Fun experience. This is an activity that you have to do. So much fun and adventure. Dune buggy rides, camel rides, belly dancing shows. Riding the dunes. It was exhilarating.

Unique experience. The trip on Dubai desert for sure is an unique experience. We book this trip streight from the hotel, and we go with ALT Dubai.Very nice, good driver and the camp was incredible with traditional food and belly dance, cammel ride and shisha.

Thrilling experience. Luckily I got a front seat. The ride through the dessert and dune bashing was very adventurous. After the dessert safari, there were nice dance and performance shows in the mid of the dessert. It is an amazing way to spend your evening.

Desert Safari. What a ride of a life time - lol- hold on tight to your set belts. These drivers are so skillful -driving over the edge of the sand dunes, one feels as if the car will roll over. Totally enjoyed that tour

GREAT TIME, buuuuuuuuut. This tour was great - the jeep sand driving was awesome, lots of fun. The camel ride was a joke! You get on the camel, go approximately 10 steps and back and that's it. I was very disappointed in that! They offer you a "real" camel ride for $25 more, then you get a meal (the air-conditioned section is $25 more), only thing free is water and soda and the buffet. The "extras" were never mentioned when booked. Was disappointed with the camel ride part mainly. Food was NOT very good, but I am a picky eater so.........
Amazing Desert in Dubai!. I really enjoyed riding 4x4 having dune bashing, first i was feeling dizzy after i feel the enjoyment of the rides heheheh. Feeling happy on this day.
Very touristy !. We felt the place very touristy and camel ride very short. Snaps with eagles is fun but sale of those snaps is super expensive. Okie dokie experience though we liked the landscape.
Sunset Dinner. pretty awesome place to organise a group drinks and cocktail and then head to dinner with some folk music and dance. private property well managed

Great but short. You must do it if it is the first time is Dubai.It is a few hours trip, but very interesting.Tip: Check first with your hotel before booking this trip with another organisation, because it might be cheaper for exactly the same experience.
A remarkable landscape. You will love this. We did it with Platinum and we would do it again. The opportunity of seeing such a vast landscape so close to a major city is extremely rare. Do it!
Whow. The dunes are something that everyone should experience, if you like wild rides..Also the dinner in the dessert is wonderful and the entertainment is fabulous

Beautiful sunset. Dubai desert tour was the greatest experience of my life . They were hired by the hotel , which took us back . The desert sunsets we watched it , looks stunning . The desert is very delicious dinner , free henna for women , and many other programs there is .

Fantastic Experience!. I had the best time on the desert safari. From start to finish it was such good fun and the time went by so quickly. We got picked up and driven to the desert which took about an hour from our hotel (a little pit stop at a small shop where we could buy water, snacks and use the bathroom). My friends got head wraps, but I wouldn't say they are entirely necessary. It's up to you if you want to pay for one. I suppose it adds to the desert experience! The dune bashing was unbelievable. I feared for my life and couldn't stop laughing and whooping the whole time. It was like a perilous rollercoaster. You go in a parade of about 6 jeeps, so you can see the ones in front of you sliding all over the place which adds to the fear. It was awesome. Keep your seatbelt on for sure, hold on tight and don't have any windows open. Some drivers are more daring than others, so be prepared for some reckless moves. The desert was beautiful, though and after much bashing we stopped to take photos and absorb our surroundings. Another tip- wear shoes that don't allow much sand in. When we arrived at the BBQ, we were welcome to enjoy an hour of camel riding, henna, buy souvenirs and shisha (you could pay to have it at your table). We were then promptly served starters, mains and dessert plus soft drink. The food was SO GOOD! I piled my plate high and was very satisfied by what i ate. There was plenty for everybody and there were a good few of us. The performances were also amazing- a fire dancer, a spinning man and belly dancer really got the evening going. They were great to watch. I would recommend this to anyone. It's definitely value for money- it included a lot of things and we all had such an enjoyable day.

Exhilarating experience. We had the most wonderful driver called Mohammed on our desert safari. The entertainment during dinner was exquisite, The food was very good. I even has a henna painting for free.
ADVENTURE IN JEEP. Not for old ages or pregancy womens and those suffer from back problem..it is fun scary thrill to travel jeep on desert safari.best adventure for colleges teens

Awessome..dont miss. Desert safari in 4Wx4A car is awesome experience.It cant be described, just experience the up and down on sand dunes. Dinner after safari is not good, but you will get it in package, so be prepare for dinner. No belly dance in holy month of Ramadan.

It's experience of desert in car was stomuch vomiting experience. Where is happiness in it i no where found anything but in desert you will feel relax. I saw allah and mohammed peace be upon him on sky in cloud clearly. It was written in arabic. Belly dance must see. Tour huts of foods was good.

Very beautiful. It was lovely to drive in to the open desert but please ensure that you have experienced drivers and good strong 4x4 vehicles which have been modified to go into the desert. Also ensure that you have plenty of water, food and a full tank of gas.

Desert Duning Dubai. The sand dune bashing was surreal. I had never been to a desert before. The desert safari tour brings people to the interior and good part of the desert. As far as the eye can see, its all sand dunes. I felt out of this world. As much as I enjoyed it I became very dizzy after 15 mins. But it was worth it. We took a 10 min video from the front seat and had it uploaded to Youtube. The second part of the tour for me was a bit disappointing. After the duning they took us to a man made desert camp. It was the attitude and the way they ran the camp. They always try to get people to spend more for various things. We were treated like cattle herds during the buffet dinner. They told people to hurry and move along the queue lines. So we had to quickly take our food and move along. A lady asked us if we would like to have the VIP table which meant a proper seating table and food would be brought to us during the shows and before everyone gets to eat. The charge was 150 USD for my husband and I and our two small children. Later she reduced to a 100 USD. She said the queue would be very long. We declined and later when dinner started there we three queue lines and the wait was not long and line moved quite fast. The shows were good. I wish dinner started earlier instead of about 7.30pm or past that.

Desert Safari. I have been to desert safari earlier also.....this was my third visit...its a good experience once again.....the ride is very adventurous....then the belle dance, followed by fire dance. The food is good.......in all a must for the visitors......
Doon Bashin. Amazing Trip, Doon bashing, Sheesha, Tandura Dance, Belly dance. Food was not so good. But the overall experience was amazing.
nice place must visit its hatta oman value for money. nice places very enjoy the ride, free dinner, bely dance, shows was there nice & very enjoy with family or friends dance was superb must visit

nice. A nice piece of well conserved desert with few animals and touristy infrastructure - that serves the purpose of providing a novel experience to tourists - sand smashing in SUV , and very short falcon show, camel rides and evening wet up of belly dancing with drinks .. overall a good show for one time visit

A must do activity in Dubai. One of the best "tourism" activities I have done. Dune Bashing, Live dancing show, camel riding, Quad Bike and good food is what you want to have as memories. Book a safari with sunset programming. Amazing to be in the desert when the sun will set down. A combination of a jeep safari, dinner in the desert and a great Toyota Land Cruiser brings the complete fun to you!!! It's an activity one must not miss

Popular attraction to tourist. We visited the desert by 4x4 wheel drive which is quite popular among tourists. This program has provided an exciting option to visit the famous desert in addition to other entertainment like camel ride, dune bashing, belly dancing, shisha testing, Arabic coffee and BBQ dinner. Your trip is not complete without it.
We visited this reserve from the air via a hot air balloon. The desert is very cool to view from the air. We were able to see different types of animals from the air.

Highlight of our holiday. We booked a desert safari with Arabian Adventures. Had a fantastic trip complete with falconry display, camel rides, henna tattoos, watching the sunset, food under the stars and a belly dancing show. Totally recommend it as this was the highlight of our holiday.

Beautiful!. The desert is beautiful and the dune bashing was an experience! The entertainment was great and the food was AMAZING!! The only thing I didn't like was there was lots of trash in the desert and I noticed the drivers were just throwing the trash out the windows. I hope that's something they stop in the near future to bad to ruin a a beautiful treasure. If we go back we'll do it again!
great. This was really fun. After driving trough the desert we had some great barbeque meal with exellent entertainment

A memory for life. We went out here to relax for a barbecue, tires on our Jeep were deflated to allow travel over the sand, parked up beside an oasis, set up the barbecue, deck chairs table etc, kicked off the shoes and just crashed out to the setting sun in 42 degrees, food finished watched a new full moon come up over the desert, lit a fire and chilled out for another three hours, what an incredible experience, never to be forgotten. We re-inflated the tyres and headed back to the City under a full moon at 27 degrees C, could have stayed all night!
Amazing Experience!. If you go to Dubai and do not grab the opportunity to go to the Desert Safari, do dune bashing and enjoy the desert night camp, my friend, you are seriously missing a lot!
4wd sliding!. Unbelievable experience. Thoroughly professional team by Arabian Adventures. The scenery, food, drinks and entertainment was exceptional.

AMAZING experience. We visited the Dubai Desert Conservatin Reserve during out stay at Al Maha resort. The experience was simply stunning and amazing. The area is just breathtaking and special. I never thought that desert could be so beautiful! A MUST!

Morning nature safari including breakfast. We joined others going on an early morning nature safari in the Conservation Reserve that included a 'Bedouin' breakfast. We were picked up from a nearby hotel in a comfortable, 4-wheel drive vehicle. While it could have seated quite a few, we had it to ourselves, so all four of us could enjoy a window seat.We saw lots of oryx and gazelles, and two large lizards, plus many birds. We enjoyed the 15-minute camel ride to our breakfast spot in the shade where we enjoyed good Arabian coffee, fresh dates, pancakes with honey, chickpeas, and noodles. Was this genuinely a Bedouin meal, or just one that would appeal to visitors from 3 continents?The starting point in the Conservation area had neither toilets nor water, so make sure to go before you leave home, and bring your own drinks. Water was provided, however, as part of the breakfast, and there were toilets near there, though we were not told about them.
Desert - Breathtaking....sunsetting. made my 50th Dream come true by being in the desert, riding on a 4x4 and camel ride!!! wow what more than a 50 year old woman want.

A bit different desert experience. Above and beyond the usual desert experience, this park offers insights into flora and fauna that can thrive in this environment with consistent conservation efforts. This might not be worth the trip (1 hour each way from Dubai) unless it is combined with other nearby activities.
Exhilirating!. The safari was awesome. We very much enjoyed it and would definitely do it again. The rush was terrific!

The most wonderful adventure in Dubai. Desert safari is the most wonderful adventure tour in Dubai. The skill of experienced drivers is really amazing. It gives a different thrill and value for money. Don't miss the belly dance and fire show after the desert safari, which generally come as a package

Exciting . Really an exciting experience. We love it, an experienced driver pick up us from hotel with a hammer, and we went to the desert, exciting driving in the sands, and then interesting show full of dancing and singing, and a complete dinner at the end.we would do it again.
Exciting trip. We had an excellent tour of 4x4 what an experience in the desert and complicated by a nice food and belly dance yooh it was nice.

Out of World Experience. Desert Safari is something one can't missing if you are in Dubai ; exclusive attraction and if you can book your safari on Haamar ride nothing like it
Camps are wonderful with cultural everts and Nice arabic food
Desert Experience. You can have a taste of the desert with safety by visiting here. If you want you can book and stay at Al Maha Desert Resort for better experience.

May 2016. Went for the afternoon safari with North Tours - only £35 each and includes 45 minute dune bashing in 4 wheel drive (hair raising and no good if you get travel sick...). Then had beautiful barbecue in a camp in the desert - first class food, loads of it and soft drinks are free. Entertainment is average though (the ubiquitous belly dancer etc). Pay for extras e.g.: quad biking.

A roller coaster ride. This is a must do. Enjoy the trip to the desert in a 4x4, The ride alone was a real roller coaster and enjoyable. Once you arrive you get to choose various activities like riding a camel etc. You then relax whilst you are entertained by a fire show and belly dancers, The meals were deliciously prepared on fire.

A must do in Dubai. We loved our tour! You'll see wildlife, dune bashing (make sure you take Dramamine if you get car sick) and have dinner under the stars at a Bedouin camp. Wear tennis shoes instead of sandals would be my suggestion. The sand is really pretty and so fine!

nice tour. comparing to red sand dune trip, this is similar but less beautiful pictures view . But I still enjoy it ! The driver always care of us to ask us if we can take the ride. One more thing, I asked if he can teach me sand drive since I drive SUVs daily. He agreed . However, it was kind of dark, so I did not try.
HOLD ON TO YOUR HATS. This is a must driving up and down these dunes by a driver who knowes the limits of the vehicle. Get on board for a thrill of a life time.

One time only activity. I would advise other travellers to book online to get a better deal. We got an excellent one as we were happy to take the free shuttle service till the spot from where safari starts. (our hotel was 2 mins walk away from the common pick up point). We were then taken on safari in land cruiser which was thrilling. Its a 10 mins drive to the camp where all the entertainment shows await you. You are served free meal which is not very exciting or appetizing. In all fairness I would not want to rate it bad but to me it was one time affair. I don't think I would like to do it again if I ever visit Dubai again.
scary but amaaaazing. Really fun but scary to at the same time. Would love to do this again and the driver who picked us up from the hotel to the desert was truly a very nice gentlemen.

This is an absolutely fantastic trip!. This is an absolutely fantastic trip! If you are keen to learn about the heritage of Gulf this is a great place to start. Entertaining throughout and a great way to absorb the culture. Camel ride, a falcon show, visit and dining at beguine camp, so much information about traditions plus entertainment. Everything done just a right way. This is definitely a must do!
Exciting excursions. One of the exciting excursions in Dubai is very cheap can hear a wonderful tour of the desert and enjoy Bedouin tent and belly dancing with tasty food

So much fun!. We had very good driver, who drives the jeep (Hummer) fast but good, it was scary, but actually it was fun. Dinner was delicious, we tried the narghile and we was impressed by the dancing show.
Classic sand dunes. Classic landscape of sand dunes with the occasion wildlife that isn't afraid of you. Dune bashing in Toyota Land Cruisers is exhilarating.

Ultimate experience. Never miss Dubai dessert safari if you are in Dubai. You will experience a roller coaster ride in Dubai safari. It is completely different experience and not very expensive. You get to see Belly dancing show and other entertainment.

Sand dunes, sand and more sand. This is quite good fun - beware if you suffer from motion sickness however - the drivers are really good and they are safe - the experience of being in the desert is unique.The dinner was a buffet and pretty good - with camel rides to try if you feel so inclined. Its about an hours drive outside of Dubai so make sure you have enough time

What a drive. Sadly I suffer from travel sickness & Vertigo so what should have been a very enjoyable adventure was a bit of a nightmare for me however the excursion itself and people involved were all fab
Scary but fun!. It was really cool, the ride was scary but fun as well and at the top we enjoyed sand boarding. The highlight was the BBQ dinner, food amazing and it was fun doing belly dancing

So much fun. Abbas was such a great driver and I had so much fun in the desert. While the food was outstanding and plentiful, the VIP treatment through Milan tours made it even better. Another great tour with Milan tours and their outstanding guides. Everyone needs to do the desert tour and hopefully, you will get Abbas as your driver

Brilliant 4x4 safari experience along with Beduin village trip. Whilst I had to admit I was not looking forwards to this trip, organized by my company after our Middle East conference, I have to say it was a brilliant experience all round, A must do if you visit Dubai

Rollercoaster on 4 wheels!. That's how the drive through the desert felt! Driving over some of the sand dunes felt like we were falling off the edge of the earth! I think this was the highlight of our trip. We used Ocean Travel Tour company which was very organized. The view at sunset in the desert is very picturesque (I took an amazing award winning photograph: if I do say so myself lol)
I totally recommend it. If you are going to Dubai you have to do this. the experience is wonderful, the people are so nice and is not expensive at all.

Best part of my trip to Dubai. A must do for any one visiting Dubai. The ride theorugh the desert is beautiful, the sunsets magnificient. We had some people complain about how rough the drive was but we had a wonderful driver that reduced speed when we asked him to. It was a fun fun trip and would definitely do it again. For less than $100 we did the safari and had a wonderful dinner in the desert with drinks and belly dancing, henna, all free!
Also Dubai has beautiful nature!!. Different but beautiful. A must see. I can highly recommend a visit to the desert in this particular area with the nice red sand colors!

Breathtaking adventure. This was the one of the things to do before you retire, amazing experience and breathtaking location with wide variety of events in desert. Must visit place for all who visit Dubai.

Exhilarating and enjoyable experience. We booked the tour with dinner at the camp in the Reserve. We were picked up at our hotel promptly at 4.30 pm as advised. It was about a 45 mins drive to the Reserve and we were given a running commentary by our driver Paulo along the way. We hopped off the air-conditioned MPV to a land rover, an option we have chosen.The alternative is to ride on a camel. It took another hour or so driving in the desert to reach the camp in the Reserve. Along the way, Paulo stopped at various scenic spots in the desert for photo opportunity. Bringing a camera is a must. We saw some wild life and rare desert plants and Paulo provided a detailed description and conservation efforts to keep them.On reaching the camp,it was almost pitch dark and the temperature cooled down quite a bit from the 40 C plus during the ride in the desert. We were given a tour of the camp and the traditional cooking facilities. Some local entertainment were arranged before dinner. The dinner was amazingly good and tasty with lamb cooked in the traditional Bedouin style, in a hole in the ground and other middle eastern cuisines, It was the first time we drank camel's milk and it tasted like skim cow's milk. The tour was very well organised, the drivers and staff at the Reserve were friendly and helpful and a great meal. Overall, a great adventure not to be missed. In particular, thank you Paulo for being such a friendly and knowledgeable driver/guide.

Vacatio was sweet,. My husband and i, did this we loved it, must try. I took awome pic. Is a amazing veiw, is a amazing experience, being in a desert in the other side of the worLd. Im from florida, my husband got me this trip as bday gift.
Adventure ride and masti to the fullest. Dune bashing , belly dancing , camel ride and much more . Food here is a disappointment , specially vegetarian food , is not palatable
4 wheel drive and dinner. While we were in Dubai, we felt we must do a 4 wheel drive and dinner in the desert. The 4 wheel drive was exciting while the dinner was very enjoyable and relaxing.

Excellent; a must do. If you don't like roller coasters, do not do this as the rides over the dunes feel like a non-stop roller coaster. I personally enjoyed it (but I enjoy roller coasters), however, some other people in the car felt a bit car sick. Overall, the beauty of the desert will win your heart. A day you will never ever forget.
Desert Safari. Good drive on the sand dunes. Went on a Hummer. Drivers drop the tyre pressure before taking us to the dunes. Slopes are quite rollicking. Sunset view is great with the orange skyline

Amazing Experience. Desert safari in Land cruiser was an amazing experience. They pick & drop you from your hotel. Just before entering the desert, they remove good amount of air from the Tyre so that they can do the roller coast ride. Then the journey was amazing, going up & down through sand dunes. They stop in between for sun set in some place. .

Go bare footed or in thongs. This is amazing! We were here in the late afternoon and I was expecting the sand to be boiling hot, but it was nice (it was April). The sand is so fine that it will go through all your footwear. It is nice to wear either no shoes or thongs to avoid the sand going through your footwear.

Dune Bashing Morning Drive. Booked this excursion through our hotel the day before. Got picked up from our hotel around 7.30am in a comfortable 4x4 for the 1 hour drive to the desert conservation reserve.The dune bashing experience last around an hour with multiple stop-off points for photographs. We then tried the Sandboarding and Fat Cat Bike activities.Definitely recommend the sandboarding! This was so much fun and our guide was kind enough to video our attempts for us.Our guide was friendly and very knowledgeable - keen to share a lot of information about the wildlife and surrounding areas.Breakfast was provided for us in the Bedouin camp - pastries and jam, fruit cocktail and muffins. Much welcomed after our early start. We departed the conservation reserve around 11.30am which was perfect as the heat was picking up. Definitely recommend for a thrill!
Sundowner Dune Dinner Safari. Another must for your visit. The evening includes: sand dunes in a 4X4; sunset photo opportunity; falcon display; camel ride; dinner in a Bedouin encampment. Fantastic.
Sundowner Dune Dinner Safari!. if you want a perfect tour of the desert take the Sundowner Dune Dinner Safari with Arabian Adventures.

Great Fun..... a must do.. Booked this online on the day! Picked up from Hotel 3pm and taken to desert area. Transferred to land cruiser and then out into dunes for 30 minutes or so "dune bashing". Thrills and no spills!. Quick photo stop and then off again. Finish up at arabic bbq after quick camel ride - Watch sunset over spectacular dunes then evening entertainment includes local dance, fire eater and belly dancer. Buffet meal and unlimited soft drinks. An enjoyable day out and great value at AED 120! Will do again.
Its a must do things for Adventure lovers. You can say it a kind of extreme sport. Riding in curve of sand with Land Cruiser or Hummer is gives a thrills with its name only.
Desert safari must. You have to experience this! Complete with Dinner and bell dancers. Drinks also available and you can do a little shopping

An unforgettable afternoon!. First time enter into the desert, have feeling with excitement but also a bit scary! The pumping ride with four wheel drive up and down the desert was like riding roller coaster which will never found in other places.
Loved this tour. Tour is a must. Camels, falcon, food, dancer make for a memorable evening. This was one of my favorite tours in any country.

Driver was a nutter. Definitely not for the faint hearted, driver was incredible, throwing a two tonne 4x4 land cruiser over the sand dunes like a rally driver, fantastic views at the several stopping places..
Amazing exprience. Take the passenger side front seat only if you are not weak at heart. Amazing adventure. A must do for anyone who visits Dubai.
Had a great time !. Had a good time, loved the safari, the dunes were awesome, the bellydancing with food is at the end of the day just before you leave, will take a whole day to do everything.
DESERT SAFARI. It is one of the best experience. had dinner in the desert and was nicely made. saw belly dance and tanoura show. best place

Work in Progress. While it's great to see so much land dedicated to conservation, and the work that's going on here is commendable, until an apex predator is introduced, it's just the desert equivalent of cows in a field. The Arabian oryx and gazelle are plentiful, but there's not much else to see. When the Arabian wolf is introduced (imminently), the whole ecosystem will become something much more exciting, with the animals behaving more like the wild animals they effectively are, rather than the pampered zoo creatures they think they are. With the wolves will come a greater presence of vultures, sand fox, rodents, and an all-round better conservation reserve. Then this will be a place perfect for expeditions and ethical camping holidays. In the meantime, if you don't know much about the desert environment, it's not a bad place to begin your learning.

very amusing experience. One hour drive from dubai, you will enjoy a great desert experience. Book in place your desert safari and you will enjoy a great sunset and a touristic but good dinner "all you can eat" with belly dancers.
Beautiful and peaceful!. Well looked after and taken care off Reserve! A short drive out of Dubai and an excellent location for a short break!

Awesome !. It was an outstanding moment to get in the desert and do a "safari", you'll enjoy the music and the traditional dance, as well as the camels... The one i had taken was said to be 65 years old? !!! Enjoyed it big time !
Small trip. If you want to enjoy at the desert, you can go. The place is okay but evening shows are better. Nice..

Unforgettable Experience. We arranged this tour through our hotel. We were picked up around 3 p.m. in a luxury white SUV that could seat seven people. We had a one-hour drive through the outlying villages to the desert area. The driver was amazing and answered our questions about life in Dubai. A stop to view or purchase your own ATV desert ride, buy refreshments, and use washrooms, gave the driver time to lower the tire pressure in the vehicle so it was ready for the dune ride.With the music cranked up we slid, slided, and rode the dunes for about twenty minutes -- exciting and not for the faint of heart or back. We then stopped to take pictures of the dessert landscape.Followed up with the trip to an oasis where we sampled the local food, music, camel rides (optional), and an excellent show. The sunset was fantastic.This was a highlight of our Dubai trip.

Excellent experince. The desert safari is done by Land Cruiser with an experinced Driver who are only allowed to drive in the dunes.It is a life time experience while travelling up and down the sand dunes.The sun set as seen from there is a beautiful sight.There are companies in Dubai who carry out the trips for a costs per head and it also includes other programes and dinner at night on desert camps

Dune bashing and dinner in the desert!. Loved my experience in the desert! Went dune bashing, saw a falconry display, picked wild dates off trees (delicious!), had a (very) short camel ride (wish it was longer) and ended with a luxury dinner in a tent in the middle of the desert complete with henna tattoos and belly dancing. Even if it was a bit touristy, I totally didn't care. This was an incredible experience and I'd for sure do it again!

Unexpected. I wish I was told about the wild and long ride through the sand. My stomach was upset, some people in my group even vomited. But the dinner and the shows afterwards were spectacular. not to mention the Camel ride, the free henna and the Hooka.(all inclusive)
Nice experience even if is a fake. Is a fake like everything in Dubai, but you can take very nice pictures and have a very nice dinner in the luxury camp.

So exciting!. Our trip to the desert was so exciting for our little grandson, Frank. The more he squealed for joy as the driver of our jeep style 4 by 4 went up and down the sand dunes the more the driver chose to go up and down them. Nana was not as keen. The heat of the desert was like that of an oven. ( May ) The food provided at the camp was lovely ,very authentic and so was the whole experience but be aware you are sitting on very hard cushions and rugs on the floor. Maybe not as exciting for pensioners like ourselves. A great experience and one I will never forget but a one off for me!
Authentic Desert Experience. Working with a tour group, we traversed the Dubai Desert in 4 wheel SUV's. It was barren (of course) but the sunset was breathtaking.

Desert splendor. The UAE have perfected the art of making their visitors to enjoy everything about their country. The desert experience is breathtaking and watch sunset from the sand dunes was breath taking!!

unbelieveble. All I can say - this was the highlight of the trip. Really really happy with this experience. we took a tour with a company - Arabian adventures. there was six of us in a car and our driver was very good. he shared a lot of knowledge about UAE and Dubai history and some interesting facts. He was driving carefully, but still with a fun :) and constantly was asking if we are ok. driver said that some times people are feeling sick while driving in the desert, but we were fine and really enjoyed it. There was enough stops to take pictures were noting else is visible just a sand :) we really had enough time and the was no rush at all, so we felt relaxed and happy to experience it. The evening program was quit good and the diner was great (they served some alcohol) - eat what you want and as much as you want. really amazing experience and I would repeat it again and again. still unbelievable how the people survived in the sand and how did they found the way, as there is nothing just a sea of sand :)
fun mix. seemed a little chaotic at first, but then the drive, the ATV ride on the dunes, camel rides, the shows, the food,etc...was worth it.

A bit of nature left in the Emirates. The Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve is well worth a trip, this should be organised from Dubai. As far as we could find out an individual trip is not possible except by staying in the Hotel of the National Park.We travelled 45 minutes around on the sand roads of the National Park, which was nice but to our impression too short.The advantage of the National Park was that we have not seen the tours of 4WD cars driving up and down the dunes, destroying everything what may grow or live in the desert. We hope that this shall not be allowed in the National Park.

Dune Bashing. Dune bashing overall was fun but I hoped there was more to do. The camp after the safari was fun, the alcohol deals were amazing. 30 AED approx for a Corona. Again a must do when you visit Dubai. The evening slot of 4pm is the best to see the sunset, to see the desert through daylight and moonlight.

Good Experience. The desert safari I booked with Happy Tours, because I went on my own, I ask them to pick me and drop me from my apartment, and they did that, that safari include Dune bashing, Camel ride, bike ride, Henna painting, shesha smoking, belly dancing and some cultural activities, buffet supply of food including Veg and Non Veg.Whole activity would take about 5 hours. (but most of this places are handle by Indians or Pakistanis , i mean it is not real Arabic, so in experience wise its good but i felt that it is not real Emirate thing.)
its a desert experience only. this is highly recommended if you have not been in the desert; great experience with sand dunes and camel riding; can also book for a safari

took the jeep ride and camel too. the camel ride only lasted about three minutes. so it was very disappointing, they had sand boarding but it was only one ride down that lasted about ten seconds unless you wipe on on the way down. the jeep ride was awesome and the dinner dance show was okay. please consider tipping the drivers they really appreciate it.
Worth going. I would recommend booking with the Dubai Conservatory group. Though more expensive it's a better service and experience.

Take a Dramamine before you go, but do not miss it..... We did a dune safari with my wife: unbelievable experience, but if you have motion sickness, take a Dramamine before you go. You will see in sunset in the desert, which is spectacular! The four-wheel drive will be go climbing dunes, one after another at very fast pace. The sand will be kicked sideways by the tires, the car will slide down taking impulse and climb another dune...Your heart beat will speed up while your go-pro saves the memories for a later sharing with your friends....

Different but nice experience. A nice experience.You are taken to the middle of the dessert in a Jeep. That journey per-se is a different and adventurous ride.There are some cultural activities, food and other fun activities once you get to the middle of the dessert.Whole activity would take about 5 hours. Best kept for the afternoon/evening time.Bear in mind that it can be very hot during mid day at the middle of the dessert.SO make sure you take enough water to hydrate yourself. Of course you can also buy refreshments in the middle of the dessert, as well if need be.
Fantastic evening. The desert safari is a fantastic experience. Dune bashing to belly dancing to dinner - Everything was well organised and the experience overall was great!

A must do in Dubai!!. We booked safari with Desert Rock Tourism! We booked over e-mail and lady called us daay before the trip to confirm it all. We paid directly to the driver in front of the Lulu Supermarket. Dune driving, camel ride, hanna painting, and dinner - everything was great! Recommend!
Desert Safari. Desert Camp is Great, Dune basking is adventurous in Desert Safari, if you go to safari then ride Quad bike or Burpi (four wheeler jeep)

Excellent reserve . Excellent conservation reserve. There are two ways to really take advantage of this great place. Staying at Al Maha or doing an organised tour with Platinum Heritage. Both are fantastic. You won't see any quad biking, dune bashing or fake tourist belly dancing rubbish here. What you get here is an education into desert life and some true culture
desert safari. My best experience yet! It was amazing driving in the desert, riding the quad bike in the desert and seeing the belly dancers, henna application by the locals
Get ready for a bumpy ride!. Booked a dune bashing session. Sands were lovely but if anyone is going dune bashing - beware - its a very bumpy ride and recommend you don't eat anything beforehand!
Great place. We did the 4 wheel drive /camel ride. It was great fun riding over the dunes. the driver was great showing us the dunes. They great drivers

Great experience. Went with my husband and 24 year old daughter. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. The dune bashing was enjoyed by all of us and we had a chance to have our pictures taken with falcons. We did the sand boarding, and had a nice dinner with a live show which was enjoyable.Only part of this trip we didn't enjoy is the camels. We felt very sorry for them, seemed to be very over worked and were not given any rest. The camel owners would put 2 rider on each camel and have them walk about a couple of hundred yards and back again, then let the riders off and do it all over again with out any rest. In some cases the 2 riders would be 400 lbs & more. You could see the camels struggling and being over worked.

desert safari in the morning. i did the morning safari which is not attached with all the night activities only dune bashing , liked it very much the power of land cruizer and the skill of driver tested. advantage in the morning if the crowd is less they do more wild driving.
GREAT EXPERIENCE. Its a very well organise tour. Starting with pick-up, the adventure between the dunes and the great dinner at the bedouin camp !
Adventure. Package include all dinner , dune bashing, a falcon show, camel riding . children enjoyed all and also they had belly dancing and local entertainment . Good Fun

Just Deserts. This was highlight of Dubai trip, filled with 4WD dune drifting, animal watching and ATV circuit riding. More than a marina walk, the desert opportunity - the onyx, deer and stars - and insanely fun driving left memories the sands of time won't cover. Must do and possibly for less than this number indicates.

VACATION 2015. This is one thing you must do when ever in Dubai,else you have not been to UAE. The life style of an Arab is attached to the Desert. The fun here is memorable and you will always wish to come back soonest.
Beautiful Place!. It was awesome!!! Best experience ever! I loved this tour, I highly recommend it. I Enjoy this day on my trip!

Desert Adventure. During a visit to Dubai we booked to go on a desert adventure in a 4X4. The company picked us up in Dubai and took us out to the desert where we were treated to an hour of desert driving over the dunes - what a BLASTHighly recommended and a MUST on anyones bucket list of things to do.Absolutely AWESOME

Awesome adventure. We really enjoyed the excursion - desert safari. Sand bashing was a bit scary as the drivers really go wild on these expensive land cruisers. At every curve it almost felt like the vehicle is going to turn over a good adventure overall though. Family really enjoyed the time in the camp were food and drinks were served as well as different shows and camel back rides
