A great experience. We did a dinner dune safari with Arabian adventures, great from start to finish, dune driving, falconry, camel ride, henna painting, food and drink. Only down side was we were in the very back of the jeep and it was a bit tight for my husband who is tall.

need some adrenaline ??. as a beach person I couldn't imagine that I'd fall in love with desert but I did.... it was breath taking being on the desert, the infinity feeling it gives you need to experience it to understand.and of course for sure for some adrenaline you need to take the desert ride but make sure that you are not getting sick cause there were few people really got sick on the ride so be sure you are not too full and something in case to ease your stomach :) and try to go there on the sunset so you can enjoy watching the sunset before the dinner

Amazing experience. Desert Safari was really nice experience with driver Mr Ali from Oasis Palm tours. but the BBQ dinner by Oasis was not even like worth rushing, limited options, most of the items finished before all tourist get it. Oasis BBQ staff treated tourist like beggar and came here without paying anything for free food.Dance performance was really amazing.I will suggest to not miss the Desert Safari but stay away from Oasis Palm. There are other travel agencies also which provide same package

Breath taking Experience. We chose this adventure because we wanted to see the desert. In Dubai, we saw a lot of man made buildings but not much of nature. We were surprised that our driver is Pakistani. We shared with him our previous visit to Gilgit. The Reserve offered many options, some of them not common experiences, like falcon watching and rolling up and down the sandy landscape. There are choices of difficulties.We chose the least challenging but my poor wife still felt nauseated. There was a nice desert meal and Belly Dancing. People could ride camels but I preferred taking picture of the beautiful sunset. A Desert Sunset is indeed a memorable experience.

This is a MUST-DO for Dubai visitors. Whaooo; this was a great experience, and real thrill for adrenalin junkies. Certainly beyond my expectations.We were issued 4X4 Toyota Land Cruiser, with a very experienced and friendly driver from Iran (Bashir). the trip started off with forward and sideward sways and swing on the SUV cutting through dunes and sand. I couldn't stop the wife and kids screaming through the near-vertical drops, side-swings, crest rides, etc. It was really fun and different.The food at the camp met basic expectations, considering the venue and how far it from 'civilization'. a buffet in the desert is an experience.we had some star gazing moments where one comes in touch with nature, and wonder at the majestic creation of God, and his awesomeness (for those who believe). You cannot but realize how small you are in comparison to this great creation, and why you cannot afford to live without acknowledging the existence and rights of the next person.A bit disappointing was the belly dancer; just one girl swinging her hips through the session. It was nice at the start, but quickly became mono-tonous. I guess they could introduce some more excitement here.Overall, great experience, I will certainly want to do this again, though I am sure my spouse has had her fill already.

Ride the Camel thru the Desert Sands. Had a wonderful experience in Dubai riding a camel and having traditional Bedouin dinner. The reserve is located about an hours rude from the main city. You have the option to pick your type of experience. There is a jeep excursion or camel ride. We chose the camels. So glad we did. What fun. The ride was about a 45 min thru the desert with your guide. From there we stopped and joined the rest of the group for a falcon show and a glass of cold juice. We all got into jeeps and headed for the Bedouin camp where we were introduced to their way of life and hospitality. We were fed a variety of food from chicken rice to lamb and stewed camel. A beautiful dance and a relaxing moment with a hookah. A must do for anyone.
Best trip in Dubai!. We did the Platinum heritage tour here and it did not disappoint. We saw plenty of oryx and arabian gazzeles. The desert is gorgeous.
A must in Dubai. The desert is beautiful and amazing. 4 wheeling and dune bashing is something you must do if ever you visit Dubai. It's a one in a lifetime experience and hard to pass up.
Amazing full day activity. If you are in Dubai and you didn't do this activity then you just waste your money. Amazing Desert activity.

Pleasant enough drive. We visited the conservation area as part of a luxury desert experience. The drive in 1940/50s Land rovers was good and a pleasant experience. The reserve is not really teeming with wild life - we saw some antelope but little else. The sand dunes though were interesting especially the way they are formed and continually shifting.

Memorable and exciting ride - colder than you think. Desert is cold during Mar, 21Degress Celsius during night time. Experience the bumpy ride, while the driver will try to get you vomit during the ride. Settle down in the middle of no where, enjoying the smooth sand and sun bath with cold breeze. Enjoy private function in the middle on desert within a castle with buffet, Shisha, belly dance, traditional dance.

Memorable. The Desert safari is a must for all those adventure lovers and first time visitors to Dubai.
These drivers are professionals and know how to drive the vehicles over the sand. The entire experience is memorable and not worth missing.

the Desert safari. wow the ride was good and enjoyable in a 4x4.you will drive in the warm desert for almost or more then five teen minute.there we did the dune bashing and on return there was camel ride and sand ski.dubai desert safari is an amazing thing you can afforded to miss out when visiting the UAE. These safaris kick off mostly in the morning.
best thing to do when in Dubai. we really enjoyed the desert safari!! the ride is like a roller coster , everyone enjoyed it ,from our 5 year old son to my 58 year old mother !!!
must go thing. i had booked my desert safari the day i reached dubai as this was first thing i wanted to do. and i was not at all dis appointed
I tried North Travel Company. I tried north Travel Companyit was wonderful Especially the Driver Akbar was very friendly and he is very talented drive
Nice and Attractive for European. floating on sands is very attractive and have a ME dinner in desert is fantastic. but usually regular tours too short.

Awesome experience. We went for desert safari and it was one of the finest rides we ever had?. The chauffeur was brilliant and absolutely very skilful...The Range Rover was literally going up and down and we have never seen something like this before... Thoroughly enjoyed the trip and also the belly Dancing and other programmes that were conducted on the camps..

Beautiful Experience. Lovely experience, serene, quiet and a wonderful experience. Lots of fun driving through the desert, particularly beautiful when the sun was setting. If you are lucky you will be able to see a few animals in the desert.

Only for dune buggy fans. I took a group of photographers to shoot here and we were all bitterly disappointed. This is an activity for those who like dune buggy rides that are quite perilous (as evidenced by all the auto parts scattered around the site). Tire tracks everywhere. We did not take one image.

A great experience you can't do in many other places in the world. We started off by being picked up from our cruise ship. we had been warned to avoid the back seat in the 4wd as there wouldn't be to much leg room. Guess where we ended up in the back seats, but we were ok with them. Leg room was ok, but my issue at nearly 6 foot was no where to put my feet and getting in and out wasn't easy.Once at the reserve they took you to see some hawks being flown where free soft drinks were provided, and then off you went to the roller-coaster drive through the desert.You couldn't have been throne around more in your vehicle, it was a unique experience, but make sure you hold on tight.They do stop a couple of times for you where you can get out and take photos. Unfortunately if you are at the back of the convoy like we were there is no way you can get a photo without people in it as all the other people have been at the location for a while before you, and very soon after you get there they start calling you back.We were on the sunset trip so at the stop to see the sunset you had to walk to the top of next dune to avoid people in your photos and then when you got to that dune you found someone on the next one in you way and so on. After about 4 dunes you finally got a view with nobody in it. Why these people couldn't have stopped at the first dune which meant we all got a view with nobody in it I don't know.After the sunset we were taken to a camp, where you got to experience more of the local life, camels rides, sand surfing, henna tattoos, food, drinks, pipe smoking, belly dancing, and finished off with them switching off the lights so you could see the stars.A great all round experience, and you get to bring some of the desert home with you with all of the sand in your shoes.

Definitely worth experiencing. We enjoyed the desert safari and the camp, with some performances, the atv bikes and camel ride.
The food at the camp was v average though.

DUBAI WHITE SAND. the wind blows the sand in waves, it is like a picture post card, we rode on camels here and we walked in the sand to the highest place it was clean and the cool sand was therapy to yr feet. we just walked and took pics.There were other people, we had egales on our hand we had to wear protection so we did not get scracted. It was like out of the movies but we loved every bit of it.

is good to ride the dunes. is a place to go if you are travelling this part of the world. but you have to be careful if you have car sickness. the only thing that did not be good is all the trash thrown by travellers and locals directly on the sand.

self. This was a very good desert safari experience and worth the money and the time we enjoy. I would say they offered a lot for the money we spent for the safari.

nice people, unique 4x4 but a little difficult on windy days.. We ended up doing this tour on a windy day, thus ended up getting a lot of sand in our eyes, ears, and clothes. The folks operating tour were pleasant the meal was good, however the falcons did not take flight.

Worth an experience. Very well preserved natural habitat. unfortunately we couldn't see much animals but was a good experience altogether.
recommend go for outdoor desert safaru. nice tour and nice view ..recommend to do some survey and choose the right tour guide and driver.tour about 6 hours.

Evening safari. We went with Arabian adventures on an evening safari through the desert that included a Bedouin meal and entertainment as well as a thrilling "Dune bashing" ride in 4x4s.A hugely enjoyable experience that included wild animals , belly dancing, henna tattoos and a meal.I would not recommend it for anyone with back or neck problems as whilst it was exciting in the 4x4s which were very luxurious you do get thrown around quite a bit.

Sickening!. Either we have the worst luck or... Yeah we had the worst driver - he drove like a maniac all from the collection from our hotel, to the desert (got a puncture on the way so had to swap tyres), weaving in and out of cars, was really scary. Got there, and unlike the other drives on the sand, this guy had to be the fastest, and get there first, which resulted in a bone shaking and crazy drive, which made me very sick! "Amazing Safari". We Done amazing dessert safari last week with Driver Sajith and Rashid,These both drivers are talented and amazing,helped alot my family to Enjoy the fantastic evening,and the dune bashing verygood and tent also well.food very tasty,over all very good,we will b back soon.
Thrilling. The Desert Safari is a thrilling experience. This is quite exciting for the young as well as for the old.

having fun. i visit last saturday in dessert safari with my friends having fun,........we rode a land cruise and had a adventure in desert! desert was really beautiful and after riding we went to a camp and there we rode camel and we had dinner and there was Arabian dance and a lot of show and drawing Hana we pay only 65dhs only.
Amazing. We went 4WD over the sand dunes with some locals. It was hairy and fun. Would do it again. You could come across some stray camels if you are lucky.
Nice dune drive and dinner. Beautiful dunes and landscape, fun drive, and very good dinner under the stars, well worth going, can recommend this.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit to see how the desert is being preserved. An interesting discussion followed by a classical display of belly dancing.

Desert Safari - A must do, if it is your first time to a Middle-Eastern Country. If this is a first time for you to a Middle-Eastern country, then the desert safari is definitely a must-do. There are numerous companies offering different packages. Cheaper ones will have shorter trips. The package normally includes dune bashing, a stop-over to enjoy the sunset over the dunes, a camp site buffet dinner and belly dancer, swirling dancer, camel rides and henna painting. Some also offers ATV rides (included in package or additional price). Pick up is usually arranged from your hotel if you are staying in Dubai. They have early morning runs or evening runs. For evening runs, which is best in my view, they will usually pick you up at about 5.30 to 6.00pm (or earlier). Sometimes, the picking up of different guests from so many different hotels, can take a long time. To avoid this, try to go in a group from the same hotel.Over the times that I have been on the dessert safari, I find that the driver makes the biggest difference. Sometimes, when you are lucky, you get a driver that is very knowledgeable and shares a lot of interesting information with you. Sometimes, if you are unlucky you get one that is inexperienced, i.e. you get stuck in the dunes and it takes time to get out of it, at the same time, they are very quiet and just drive (suspect this is because they can’t converse well in English). Most of the time the ‘nothing to write home about’ buffet dinner will consist of barbequed meat and pseudo-traditional fares. Something that I found really weird was that most of the belly dancers were not Arab, they are usually Russian or Brazilian and other non-Arabs. Just to share also that one time, we had a belly dancer that was actually rather fat (nothing against fat people here), it is just that it was not something you would expect of a belly dancer.Tips: 1. Avoid Fridays and Saturdays, as it gets too crowded. 2. Do not have any heavy food before taking the desert safari. 3. Best time to go is during winter months – much more comfortable and enjoyable. 4. Also for safety reasons, best to exclude children below nine years old, to my opinion.

Did an organised tour into the desert. * dune bashing - hold on tight!* camel rides - it's bumpy!* henna - beautifully done.* Shisha - traditional experience.* belly dancing - great show.* BBQ - nice and spicy!* sand boarding - brilliant fun.* camping out overnight -priceless.Loved every minute.

Away from the glitz and the glamour. A desert experience is simply a must do when visiting the UAE. We camp quite a bit as we live here and only need to travel a short way from home to set up tent in the dunes. Your experience will really depend on the company you go with. It has gone from being a luxury trip out at around 100 pounds per person to numerous companies now offering the trip at very competitive rates - 2 for 1 vouchers are in the Entertainer Book/App. If you go expensive there will be a longer drive - check how long - and fewer people. Avoid Fridays they are busy plus you have all us expats and locals out in the dunes too as Fridays is our day off. We tend to keep away from the tourist though if camping. If you are opting for a morning drive get sunrise - early start but worth it and it is often in the morning after a nights camping that we will see oryx and gazelle wandering across the desert. Camels are pretty easy to time as they will go into the farm for breakfast so you can see them heading across the dunes. All the camels you will see are female and they are tethered so they dont bolt off. Camels down Shk Zayed road would not be conducive to health and safety these days but they did used to roam around the city freely and we often found them in the school playground or just stood in the middle of the road.The usual tour will be a short drive - again health and safety measures are in place and these drivers are under strict rules as to where they can and cannot take you and how far up a dune they can go etc.. not in the old days when bashed up tour cars used to be brought back in the dead of night under tarpaulin so as not to put off business. A stop for sunset and photos and a soft drink is usually on offer followed by the camp site with camel rides, henna painting, belly dancing and the buffet. The more expensive ones will have all these costs covered - check the cheaper ones and what they include.You will have to wait until everybody in your car is ready to leave so you cant decide to just go when you want unless of course you have a car full of guests then pretty much the driver will go when you are ready. The camp is deceptively close to the road so only track on the way out - no dunes - and that is a good thing - nobody wants to be travelling through the dunes at night.It is a great trip - yes a bit touristy these days but if you are here then its simply a must do
Amazing experience. The dune bashing was fun. The food is quite authentic. Loved every part of it - the dunes, the sunset over them, the setting for people and the food
Must Itenary For Dubai>>Desert Safari. You Just cant miss this.This is possible only in UAE and Egypt.I did it with 2 year kid.We enjoyed it.BBQ Dinner and Dance was okay can be skipped.

Entertainment at its Peak !!!. Avoid on Fridays !!!As we went on Friday and it was over crowded due to local holiday, normally 20-25 minutes dune bashing in a 4x4 vehicle was limited to just 10 minutes, the desert camp was jam packed with more than 800 people.First activity was photo opportunity with majestic falcon for 10 dirhams each, then AVT drive 100 dirhams for 30 minutes which is too much, then camel ride, one long que for free ride of just 100 meters and another 25 dirhams which is not crowded but we have to pay, then welcome drink, Emirati coffee with dates, then cultural show was awesome !!! and then Belly dancing !!! and finally BBQ dinner which was Ok.We booked our Desert safari through Happy Tourism and paid 115 dirhams each including picking us from our hotel Jood palace ( old Taj palace ) Diera area by a 4x4 vehicle.

Must Do In Dubai. If you came to Dubai but didn't go for dessert safari than your trip to Dubai is not completed.Enjoy the best sand dune bashing in 4x4 cars and lovely arabic tents to spent a wonderful evening.

On The Land Roller Coaster Ride. This is a must-visit in Dubai if you have only a short trip there. It's a thrilling experience in the desert and for a first timer, I must say it's exciting and took back a memorable journey with me. We were picked up by the 4WD to the desert for a fun ride. I didn't know that a 4WD can be used as a "roller coaster" on the sand too! Our driver, Sulaiman from Hormuz Village, is an experience driver and it was beyond thrilling to be in his car. He sped up at the edge of a hill and just drop at the cliff and the car just roll down. I don't think anyone have such driving experience unless you drive through a desert everyday to go to work. I was warned not to roll down the window nor puke in the car without a plastic bag. I was definitely trying to hold myself together not to puke. At the Hormuz Village, we get to go on camel rides, ATV rides, sand board, tried out hanna tattoo and even smoke Shisha (smoke pipes). Some of the rides, we do need to pay but most of it is already in the package. We went with a tour group hence everything has been paid for. Else you can contact Hormuz Village for arrangement. I met a German girl who was there alone and she booked it through the internet. It sounds pretty easy. Our dinner was buffet and some BBQ meat. It was just so-so. Stage show was definitely entertaining.

An artificial experience. This tour is the equivalent to a commercial "Luau" one can get from any hotel in Hawaii. Although the tour does provide that which is advertised, the product is very commercialized. The SUV ride was fairly short with longer "Photo op" stops, the falcon demonstration was short and fairly bland, the camel ride was about 100 metres, the food was not genuine bedouin food and the photo booths in the camp were too remindful of those available on cruise ships - for an exorbitant price. The entire staff are foreigners, as in non-native UAE nationals, and even the belly dancer is from Brazil. Hardly an authentic Arabian experience.True, it's a good way to see the desert. But the whole experience has been really too commercialized to maximize tourist dollar expenditures.
Excellent. Dubai Dessert safari is organised in dessert area .. its amazing .. Desert Conservation is Hudge area

Excellent fun! but bad camps.. great safari, great fun, great photos. went with get your guide and our driver rafeek was a great person. made us enjoy every moment. village camps however are just a waste of time. bad tasteless food and too crowded to be enjoyed.

Arabian Adventures (Emirates). I did this trip with friends 12 years ago, so this time when I went with my partner, I insisted on doing it again. We booked at the hotel and were collected from there. An hours drive and you arrive, you are taken into the reserve and stop at a small tree'd area to see a falcon show. Then onto the exciting bit, 4x4 over the dunes. The tour stops for photos at sunset, which are spectacular. Please do take a jumper or cardigan as once the sun goes the desert is really quite cold.You are then driven to the camp, where a lovely 3 course self serve meal is provided. They do serve wine and beer as well as soft drinks. Camel rides are available and photos with a falcon. You can have henna tattoos done all included in the price. There is a show after the food and the belly dancer entertains with skill and sass! Before you leave they invite you to star gaze and switch off all the lights, that is quite spectacular.Highly recommend this, approx GBP 60 per person, but worth it. The trip is about 6 hours in total 3pm - 9pm.
“real desert”. One must take a Jeep Safari in Desert.It's a life time memorable experience. Camel Safari is also good.

Desert Nature Reserve. About 30 km outside Dubai City a visit to this nature reserve is an excellent way of introducing you to the desert landscape and its flora and fauna. We went with Arabian Adventures in a 4-wheel drive land cruiser that was ideal for driving off-road on the dunes. Be warned that the dune driving can be uncomfortable and I would not recommend it if you suffer motion sickness. On our visit we encountered gazelle, were able to sample the delights of fresh dates and had a brief camel ride. Another trip on offer is a sunset supper and if you have never seen the desert at night it is something I would recommend. Our trip was just for half day and our driver, who was from Pakistan, was excellent.

Amazing experience. I loved the dessert safari. They charged us AED 300 which included a buggy ride on the sand dunes, camel ride, activities and dinner in a camp - including belly dance, tanu dance, BBQ dinner, pics in the local dress, and other activities. It was quite a different experience. Dinner was good, a delight for the non-vegetarians. The dances were amazing, the rides on the sand dunes was super fun. The driver was good, the rides were smooth and fun. we watched sunset in the sand dunes - very picturous. Overall a great experience. Various tours charge different rates for the different categories of the safari, I was very happy with what we got for AED 300.Would definitely recommend that visitors experience the desert safari. It was a highlight of my trip.

desert all the way you can see...!. the experience of this place makes you meet your inner self, gives the feeling that sometimes you need to be alone as well.the desert is spread as far as you can see so to get a good experience you will need to go deep inside. there are many camps which operate in the desert. basically haveing food, hooka and seesha, mehandi, fire shows and belly dancers and tamura dance....apart from these there is the activities like dune bashing, and camel rides and buggys and dirt bikes... will give you a awesome feel if you try any...do's and dont'sgo there in the evening and stay till dark try and book a personal vehicle carry a jacket.... it can get cold do not expect really good food or a variety of options carry your camera...you can get some great pictures no matter how bad you are at photographywear sand friendly clothes.if you are not ok with adventure do not try the buggy.

Amazing dunes.. Our driver was superb. We went up and down dunes over the sides of them with the sand spraying. I admit I was clutching the seat every once in awhile but everyone else just laughed. We visited some camels and petted them in their enclosure. Altogether a fun extra excursions!

Private Sunset Dune Dinner Safari. Oryx, falcons, gazelles, dune bashing, delicious food, camels, henna painting! This is a well organized tour. Our driver/guide Raheel picked us up from our hotel and took us on an adventure!

A Great Ride. From the start it was great. Our driver picked us up from the Hotel and was on time. He was very friendly and spoke English very well. On the drive to pick up the other passengers he did a little site seeing telling us some of the places we were passing.The overall experience of riding the dooms was fun. If you love rollercoasters then you will certainly love this ride.We took a break right at sunset to watch the sunset and give our stomachs a chance to relax. I am not going to pretend I wasn't glad that we stopped when we did. I was starting to feel a little ill by this time. After watching the Sunset (almost set) we set off to the camp where we had dinner and a show. It was a few companies there but we had a table setup for our group and it was a good show. The buffet style dinner was a bit of a letdown due to the long lines and the average food that was served.But overall it was a great experience and if you have time and are in Dubai I would recommend doing this trip. But always checkout the company you pick online reviews. We used Funtours a good rating online and about average price and the fact they were on Groupon.

Thrilling!. Great thrill on the 4x4 in the desert, dune bashing it's called. Driver came to pick us up at the hotel, picked a couple of others as well and we made our way. The drive in the desert was so exhilarating, I can't speak for other drivers but ours (Abbas) is very good and the car was always under his control. Tip: carry water when you leave town, there's a stopover before the desert but prices are expensive. And it's a while before food is served.
Life time experience. Our family enjoyed it the most. Interesting rides on SUV on sand desert. Best time in January and February. You can enjoy belly dance in the evening and little buffet dinner.

Must Visit Destination of Dubai. If you are in Dubai you must plan to visit this place. Its good for people of all ages, especially for children. They provide you a ride through sand dunes in a good four by four SUV like Land Cruiser or Hummer. Most of the trips are followed by buffet dinner in a camp amidst dunes.

Must do in Dubai - good experience. Got picked up in 4x4 Toyota and few others were added, headed to desert with stop on the way where the driver reduced tyre pressure and then I came to know was to reduce the bump that we are going to have in the desert safari. It was awesome ride on the dunes, much like fun ride. We were then taken to a camp with lot of people where food and drinks were arranged with other activities. I enjoyed the Bele dance the most but felt it could have been longer. Food was good but place was over crowded and arrangements were hasty. Overall good experience. Recommend to all tourists going to Dubai.
WOW. We went for desert safari at this place in Nov15. Enjoyed a lot with family. Nice dunes which rush adrenaline in your blood.

woooooow, so exciting. That was soooooo gooooood. I like it. so good driver and beautiful view in desert with delicious dinner, Arabic dance, fire dance, light dance, henna drawing, some south Iranian music, riding desert motor and riding camel. perfect experience.

Adrenelin pumping experience. This is an experience not to be missed. A ride on the dunes,over the dunes and down the other side. I am absolutely glad to have experienced this thrilling ride. Not for the old By the way ,i am 68 YRS. A very taxing ride. Definitely not for the old and infirm and for children.

WOW to an amazing time!. you MUST, MUST do this when in Dubai. I had a marvelous time in the desert. the tour guide was very friendly, accommodating. prepare yourself for a fun, enjoyable and bumpy ride in the desert. I was definitely surprised and told all my friends about this. I had an amazing time.

The evening safari is a must. I highly recommend an evening safari excursion through the Desert Conservation Reserve. After an exciting ride over the sand dunes in a modern 4by4 we had a most enjoyable evening in a Beduin camp, with a buffet meal. This is a must do if you have a few days in Dubai

Thrilling!. Ericsson was an excellent driver! The desert tour was amazing from the perfectly fine sand, to the sunset, to the mild mannered camels, to the dinner and entertainment. This is a must experience excursion!
Desert safari. Fantastic experience worth every penny, did the tour with dubai destinations (driss) would do this again. Highly recommened
dune bashing. dune bashing was an amazing experience so were the sand scooters. a must for thrill seekers. once in a lifetime experience
Half Day Tour of the Dessert. This tour was really amazing. The cool Breeze of Desert, the Desert Safari, and in the evening. Lovely Food & Drinks with the Belly Dancing Show.
Dubai Desert. Wasn't over excited to go, but wow this was really a great thing to do ,,hit the dunes in 4 wheel drive vehicles,,staff are very competant and the adventure is really worth it
Camels!. I was able to take a sunset Camel ride across the desert here. It was the highlight of my visit. We stopped at sunset and drank champagne at a little makeshift bar they had set up. Loved it.

Nice place for adventure lovers. Its a nice place to be if you are adventure lover types. The sand bashing part is thrilling. Guys with me simply loved the bumps which give you goose-bumps. Go with a fairly empty stomach asa drive could give you some dizzyness. The later camp part of the safari is good, the food served is even better. The belly dance etal is thrill for some.Over all a good experience.
Dubais Desert. one of the best experience while in dubai. best visit time is during sunset time. you can enjoy beautiful sunset and beautiful dances.
Cool excursion to the desert.. The sand dunes surround you and the golden sunset is amazing. The falcon handler was funny and engaging. Beautiful!

Adventure... Comprising five per cent of Dubai's total land area, the park received permanent protection in 2004 as the government moved to maintain a balance between Dubai's rapid development and the need to preserve its natural and cultural heritage.The International Union for Conservation of Nature and United Nations Environmental Programme gave the park international Protected Area status in 2008, establishing DDCR as the regional benchmark for sustainable development and conservation.

Fun and exiting.. we went on desert cruise, in the afternoon, and our main destination was a dinner in the middle of the desert.the drivers were polite, smiling, and had full control over there cars.the drivers do some tricks on the sandy up-slops, it's very much like an off-road kind of experience, but less aggressive.there isn't really much to see except sand everywhere.
Dune bashing!. This a must do when in Dubai! We loved it. We did a morning tour with dune bashing and fat bike riding. Love it!Try it!
best dessert safari. we had a wonderful time the tour was wonderful,the people soo loving and kind,we really enjoyed our tour ,special thanks to our driver shafik every helpful.

Thriling and Fun experience. Its a desert safari with landcruze ride.Its a ride on sand with up and down the sand dunes.It takes about 20 minutes.Seating in the middle is preferable and if you are in a group .,then elderly and aged should not seat on backseat as there are jurks.If you have a package,then you can enjoy belly dance followed by buffet dinner and also you can have free complimentory photo in traditional arabic style dress.Heart patients and infants should not take this ride.

Lifetime experience !!!!. You will love it from the point you will sit in that SUV and come back after desert safari... it is more than just roller coaster ride.. you are actually on sand at one instance and then you will just see sky.. and then suddenly you are going down from sand mountain.. absolutely stunning... Prefer front seat with camera in one hand and handle of SUV in one hand.. you will love the experience from there... once you get down from SUB,, you see beautiful sand dunes all over with sun view... loved it and totally recommend it..
A tourist attraction. Fun in the desert for about 20 minutes and then you get to a park where you have some food such as shawarma and a belly dancing show done by a Russian lady. Waste of time

A great ride. the desert safari was one of the highlights of our trip. The skilled drivers take you for a car ride up and down the sand dunes. It is a thrilling and fun experience. Usually you can book a package deal where after the safari you can stay back for the night show + buffet dinner in the middle of the desert
Sundowner Desert Safari. This is must-do when visiting Dubai. A great 4WD experience through the sanddunes, riding on a camel, dinner and drinks in an "oasis" - wow!
Thrilling & Pleasing Experience :). Its was Exciting and thrilling experience one should go and enjoy the Arabian Sand dune with belle dance and mouth watering food . :)

4 Corners Events Desert Safari- TERRIBLE FOOD POISIONING. Don't waste your money! Big money grab ! 2 people of our group of 4 got the worst food poisoning . The only good part was the dune bashing and seeing the desert. The rest of the evening was a poorly organised tourist trap. Don't waste an afternoon and evening doing this when there are plenty of other things to do in Dubai give it a big miss!
Drive the Arabian Desert. It's a good chance to have a look at the famous Arabian Desert, to drive on dunes and to have a sandboarding experience.

Dune bashing - a worthwhile rip-off run by expats?. It remains a thrill to go dune bashing for anyone who has never been to a sand desert. It is busy - up to 200 vehicles screaming through the dunes on most days and a dusty meal in a prefabricated 'Berber village' - authenticity NOT guaranteed. That includes entertainment provided by other expats.It is all about making money - along the road at pit-stops or at the 'village'. Even locals putting falcons on your arm, grabbing your own camera to take bad photos and charge you for it.Trying to say no is difficult as they almost 'force' you into things where they can part you and your money.......

Great Experience. We had no idea what to expect here but it turned out to be very fun, informative and interesting. I would highly suggest the camel ride and found the hawk demonstration to be really interesting.
Great night.. Picked up from the motel mid afternoon and arrived back around 10pm. Sand dunes, shows, camel rides and food was great. Really enjoyed.

Very poorly managed Desert safari!. Desert Safari is very poorly managed show! Dessert safari ride is cut down to 15-20 minutes. Managed by very unprofessional people. Everywhere they ask for money! Food arrangements were pathetic. Long queues everywhere for food! Food was served to the tourists as if they were beggars! Belly dance which was main attraction of the show was performed last and by the time we start enjoying this show, driver starts hurrying up to go back to vehicles!
disappointed. Make sure you get a driver that speaks to you and explains why they stop and how you get to have a camel ride

ENJOY...Desert safari, camel ride, scooter dance & dinner . Nice trip it starts after 3 pm... land cruiser is our vehicles ... dessert safari is amazing experience. . If u r lucky .. experienced and funny crazy drives will drive for u... then after 30 minutes u will go to a camp .. There camel ride .. scooter ride ... dance .. then take photos with valture. . Hookka. .. snacks ... carpets for purchase .. beer ... finally dinner ... totally cost around 150 to 180 AED ... so don't miss this enjoy

Great Experience!. It is a great experience to visit Dubai's desert dunes.The trip is not exactly comfortable, you may feel sick since car is jumping all the time but having those views at sunset worth it!
Desert Safari. It was extremely worth experience in desert safari. nice ride in desert little bit scary. same like rola costa drive.

Conservation In Mind. Went to this lovely conservation center on a desert tour and was beyond impressed. There are animals and vegetation galore, and the conservation center does a great job with security and keeping those out who would cause harm to this environment. One thing I found interesting is that while they do provide food to the oryx, they move the food around from time to time to preserve their natural instinct to hunt for the food, instead of making them become dependent and lazy. I thought this was a thoughtful, respectful tribute to the wild nature of these animals.
Desert Safari!. Do yourself a favor and sit in the front seat of a 4x4. It will be the best time of your life. A good tour will include belly dancing, shisha smoking as part of the dinner experience.

“What an adventure!”. You have not been to Dubai if you haven't gone on the desert safari. The whole experience in the land cruisers was spectacular. The adrenaline rush in the dunes was my highlight. The sunset was wow! Another beautiful surprise awaited us - the dinner in the desert seating in a yoga position. Never been to a yoga class but I did it. Too bad it was prayer day I missed out on the belly dance. I must do a repeat.
Great. The safari is just great! Loved the ride! The desert seemed so romantic! And sunset in the desert is something! Make sure to catch it!
a must. Booked with "city tours". Really good. Quad bikes the kids loved (dont pre book, cheaper to pay when you get there) The dune bashing was a buzz and entertainment and food were good.

wonderful. The dubai desert tour was an absolute blast and the night shows were amazing! I was a little let down on the camels, they seemed a bit aggressive I assumed because of the conditions they're kept in i.e chained mouths etc, that was the only let down I didn't enjoy the ride too much.

a must try. ask for a good driver if you are not an adrenalin junkie
The desert drive was worth the cost.
Food offered is limiting

What an adventure!. You have not been to Dubai if you haven't gone on the desert safari. The whole experience in the land cruisers was spectacular. The adrenaline rush in the dunes was my highlight. The sunset was wow! Another beautiful surprise awaited us - the dinner in the desert seating in a yoga position. Never been to a yoga class but I did it. Too bad it was prayer day I missed out on the belly dance. I must do a repeat.
Beautiful. Great place to get away from the city. It's wonderful to see the wildlife roaming the desert - they get very close too. It's a pretty special place to visit.

Gooo dunes gooo. All guides speak very clear English. they drive the sand dunes like they own them are always very clear as to what would be happening next. The food is average, henna tattoos are great (for her) and the entertainment is good. Can be your favorite activity in Dubai!
amazing. For the best moments of excitement and adrenaline in combination with extra comfort in the desert camps
Great Experience!. Overall it was an great experience. It was scary as there were many ups and downs and cars were sliding everywhere,
One in a million experiance. This was the most amazing experiance ever. The car ride through the dunes was like nothing else. then the supper and live entertainment....wow!!
Interesting eveninh in Desert. Enjoyed Dune Dashing and performances at Desert safari. Camel ride too short. Food needs to improve.
Beautiful area. What a beautiful area. The color of the sand, wide view, oryx. And we went true by fat bike!! It was not to warm so that was great.

Sand Dunes were thrilled. - Best for Adventurers and bachelors
- Not suitable for kids and elders
- Bit costly but worth try once in a life time

This is one attraction which should not be missed.. The Car was suppose to pick us from our hotel. We were 7 and car was allotted to us. We requested the supplier Zafar to change the pick up from Hotel to Miracle Garden which he agreed upon. A Land Cruiser with driver name Prajeesh was provided to us. Driver took us to a resort near the desert and asked us to take a rest for an hour before he took us to main desert and camp area. There were desert scooter operating and people were taking a ride there. After that driver took us to camp area the route to the camp area is through dense desert. The ride took about 40 minutes out of which about 35 minutes were in desert with car providing a nice roller coaster ride on sand dunes. It is one experience which should never be missed. The kids and adults equally enjoyed the ride. We arrived at the camp area where free camel ride for photography was provided to guests. The food and soft drinks were included in desert safari price. The food though not great but was still ok types. There were variety of Salads on offer with Some rice and Dal and Curries. We did not had food there as kids did not liked the look of food. There was Arabic and Belly Dance as entertainment.The high point of the attraction is Car zipping on sand dunes. Once in a lifetime experience.
good experience. good experience, but i felt very sick off sand dunes, and they take you to a shop and try and force you to buy dubai outfits.

If you can only do one thing, do that. Some "fun" driving in the sand dunes, very exciting and certainly not good for people prone to motion sickness and then a nice relaxed dinner in a camp. Of course, all tourist attractions, such as belly dancing, camel riding etc. available. The food was not particularly edible for my taste, but overall it was a very relaxing experience walking barefoot on the cool sand at sunset all around the small impromptu shops in the camp, having henna tattooes and tasting pita bread just baked in front of you in the traditional oven.
sooo cool !!. Great journey, driver was so professional - realy very good, crazy adventure. Ask for Rifaqat Ali, he is great !!

Not reliable. Our trip got cancelled on 26 Dec and we had to reschedule and look for a new available date. We emailed nd got no response so we phoned. This was the only way to confirm a new booking. Our driver collected us on time but we had lots of other guest to collect and missed the sunset. The drive was okay, the food fine and the show okay. Everything was included so no hidden cost.
Wonderful Experience. Must do in Dubai and an unique experience. Only be little bit careful if you have motion sickness . You may feel nausea while doing desert rides.
a good place to enjoy. hotel pickup. long drive ti desert. buffet was gud, dance was well... loved to b in the cold desert.

Amazing time - Desert Safari. The best part of Dubai trip for us was the desert safari. We left hotel at around 3 pm and reached desert at around 430 pm after picking up others from different locations.It was an excellent drive through the desert during the dune bashing time with going up and down the dunes giving a feel like a roller coaster ride. Our driver was very nice and he even raced other vehicles in the desert with comfort which gave us a more thrilling ride. We stopped at a place for sunset photography.Following our dune bashing, we went to a place for dinner in the middle of the desert. We had a small camel ride which was fun too. Buffet dinner was nice with barbeque and a variety of Indian dishes as well. We had a couple of shows (belly dance, etc.).It was a nice experience in the desert. Had a lot of fun. Highly recommend desert safari to anyone who visit Dubai.

Must Visit!. This is definitely one of the most important highlights of any Dubai trip. The Dubai desert safari is a must-do activity and noone should return from Dubai without experiencing the amazing off-roading, dune bashing activity by 4x4 off-roaders!

desert safari by evening. the desert safari is a must if you visit Dubai region. The quad ride/sand boarding in monstrous SUV's are once in a lifetime experience. The other attractions of henna/shisha are for the women & men folk as optional. The dinner spread is sumptuous but not very tasty ( this is my 2nd experience)But to sit in the middle of nowhere in a desert & watch sunset & moon come up with some belly dancing is a different experience

Desert Safari. It's another must if you are travelling to Dubai. They have Hummer, Prado and Merc 4x4 which gives you thrill like any roller coaster. Drivers love to hear the feedback and more you clap and scream, more dunes they chart in return and you can always see a smile on their faces. They drop you to your allocated camp where you can enjoy dances and performances which are fun to watch, unlimited food and sheesha are served to you. There are lot of other fun like camel riding, ATV driving and sand art which is there to keep you busy. Don't forget to take warm cloths if you are going in Dec/Jan as nights can be chilly.

Good tour, bad driver. Our driver was 30 minutes late. Ok, no biggy. Then he drops us in the middle of nowhere to watch the sunset, then disappears. Said he needed to help another driver. Then, at the end of dinner and a show was nowhere to be found. We were last to leave. No excuse or apology, just an insincere sorryWent through city discovery who just seems to collect the money. They outsourced to orient travelDunes were great. Dinner was pretty good for a buffet in the desert. Dancing was funThe experience was spoiled by the bad driver

Desert Safari. You must try the desert safari at Dubai. The tour operator picks you up from your hotel about 3 pm and drop you back there about 9 pm. You are taken to a meeting point in the desert. The actual safari will take around 45 minutes, the experience is fun but not dangerous, we had a couple of pensioners in our jeep, they loved it.You are then driven to a desert entertainment area. The dance, drinks, food are all good, every one got up to dance together after the show.

Nice!. in that desert there are stunt jumps aka Dune Bashing organised and there are even camps for dinner and sheeshas and the food is healthy and even camel rides are organised there and oh i forgot there is the quad bike drive also.Nice Place...

Arabian nights. we came here for Dune Bashing which was a lot of fun, however we had a woman in our car who kept complaining it was going to fast at 1 point she souted at the driver that she wants to get out and get a taxi???hmmmmm dont think you can get a taxi in the middle of the desert so she had to grin and bare it. this however did not put us off and we were screaming to go faster, loads of fun :). wew ere then taken to a spot in the desert where you can have camel rides and pose with the falcon's we were then served food (not arabic food which was disappointing more indian food onion bhaji, curry, there were some BBQ meats etc) it was then time for the show which was an eastern europen belly dancer (not very authentic) but the spinning man was amazing how hes costume just lit up very hypnotising and the fire man gave a brilliant show and actually saved the show. we were then driven back to our pick up locations. all in all a good time.
Once in a lifetime experience!. Experienced Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve during our recent visit to Dubai. It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend it.
What a fantastic adventure. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the desert, 4 wheel drive dune ride, which was so much fun and dinner and show in the Desert. It was great value and a lot of fun.
we were there for the desert safari. The ride was fun. Food ok normal only is buffet style. They have activities like camel riding, ATV and some others. Overall, great experience.

It was nice but not so breathtaking. I took this excurcion beacuse of the safari in the sands. But actually it wasn't so breathtaking as I wanted it to be. The sands are always awasome, it is definitely worth going there. The village after the safari was not big, specially created for tourists. I liked food, there was enough of evrything, the show was intereting and also there was a free shisha. Also you could take photos in traditional clothes and ride a camel for free. Riding on a hourse should be extra paid.
experience of a lifetime. its exciting and very nerve racking but very safe and i enjoy the thrill of it very much even the camel ride and my henna tatoo and the food

A good experience. A good experience for people visiting Dubai for the first time. The jeep ride was amazing and a bit scary but well recommended for a first time visit. But the night entertainment at the camp was a bit disappointing.

Great expirience in Dubai desert. As first time in desert like this one. First it was strange to see sand all around. Local guide help us to be familiar with surroundings. Amazing was riding on camels, look at evening sun and local traditional dancers. Recommend!

Peace and tranquility in Dubai. A truly hidden gem.. We've lived in Dubai for 5 years, and for the first 4 had never heard anything about the Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve. And that is part of the secret of the place, for the moment.A 45 minute drive from downtown, and a short drive out into the Reserve, and you could be a million miles from anywhere. Peaceful, unspoilt, seemingly endless rolling red sand and a healthy spattering of Arabian Orynx, Gazelle and birds.You can't just drive into the Reserve though, you need a valid reason to be there, like a day trip or overnight stay at the Al Maha Desert Resort, a stay with Platinum Heritage, a trip with Arabian Adventures, or a Falconry experience with Royal Shaheen. Before you ask, we're not employed by any of these - but we are extremely pleased to have this desert beauty on our doorstep.

A must visit place. As we all know that UAE is mostly a desert.and Dubai has lots of Desert adventures . This attraction is one of them. It is a wonderful and extraordinary experience that one must have.

Wonderful Experience. Took a Desert Safari at the Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve and it was a wonderful experience. The only thing is that the reserve closes early so we had to get out before they close.
Try it. Really new and perfect experience, very exciting safari experience, nice Arabian dancers and a good dinner and snacks, you will love it just try it.
Saw it from the Hot air Balloon. We were flying low in our Hot Air balloon and could see the Conservation reserve. Very neat, saw a lot of animals and dunes. Very clean too.
Amazing day at Safari. The best tourist attraction in Dubai.. we have an amazing experience. The Dune bashing was like riding in a roller coaster.
Fantastic. Awesome experince with cruiser ride & the club which is located in it overall experience i can't explain in the words....

A must. Fun.. We took an organized tour with 25 cars which could have been a bit of a zoo, but it was well organized and our driver took good care of us. Dinner in the desert with the show part was fun.

Awesome Trip..... Went with relatives who were visting from INDIA. We were picked up & dropped at our home. Dune bashing was great. Then were driven for optional camel ride & dirt bike ride, for which we needs to pay seprately. After that they have taken us for belly & tunura dance show, both Veg & Non Veg food was avaliable. It was a memoriable experience for relatives coming to Dubai..
Cool experience. Nice different environment. Cool breeze of evening desert. Must visit once and will be memorable event for entire family.
Nice Desert. People who comes to Dubai will enjoy the desert drive and enjoy this place Superb drive in the four wheeler drive.

Best part of the Trip. This is the best part of the Trip... I would suggest this to be done in the last... As there would be something which you will remember till last. Even ask for your safari driver for Quad bikes rides... They will take you... its fun... Food is highly ok... Please carry your personal food with you.

The ride through the desert was exhilarating!!. The thrill of riding in 4x4WD vehicles at high speed across the sand dunes is exhilarating. The driver must be used to hearing everyone screaming and nervously laughing away by now but no one in our car had to use the special bags intended for those feeling queezy after the ride. I did not enjoy seeing the 5 minute falcon show. The camp where dinner was served was very nicely decorated though as it was already dark by the time we got there, there was no point in going on a camel ride. The food was tasty and plentiful. The show was very good especially the incredibly tireless belly dancer.

Great Experience. this is a trip not to be missed out on as a first time trip to Dubai. We did the trip that drove through the nature reserve in the old fashioned jeep, it was fun, and I highly recommend the experience.

A must do in Dubai. Simply the best thing we did while in Dubai. November to February are the best times of the year to do the Safari. We were picked up at our hotel at 2:30PM and returned at 9:30 PM. Rode a camel, watched a falcon show in the desert, watched the sunset, saw an Arabian Antelope and Arabian Orxy in the reserve. After the sunset we head to the camp in the desert for our dinner under the desert sky and stars. Had my sandals off the whole time we were in the Desert Reserve. Temperatures were absolutely perfect. 85 degrees at 4PM and when we left the Desert Reserve it was 80 degrees. Shorts and a light t-shirt weather. Fantastic. A must do.

Fun Fun Fun!. What a thrill ride. We had an amazing time during the desert safari. The entertainment was great.. although the food provided by the tour company we booked through was okay... the safari itself made up for that. A must to do at sunset in Dubai.
beautiful. Wow....totally awesome sights and views...do NOT forget your camera! Loves the camels...they were trained to be so friendly!

The desert safari was great. The desert safari was great and very unexpected. The jeeps were driving through the deserts going up and down the sand dunes with such speed and surprise. It felt like a long roller coaster. We were able to get out to the desert just in time for sun set. It was amazing.

nothing has changed. 2nd time doing this trip and it's the same as the first. Nothing new. For a first timer, simply expect to be driven up/down and around the desert, watch a lady tell you a brief story about the history of falconry, the show allows the Falcon to only make 2 flights that are super quick, have a buffet in the desert at night, camel ride, eat, watch a belly dancer. Free food and drinks once at the compound. Food/beer/wine is the same each time. Will not do this a 3rd time
Great Desert Trip. Well worth the trip. The falcon display was informative, the dune bashing fun and the food at the stop was authentic and good.

Desert Sunset and camels too. The Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve was a relaxing get-away after spending several days in the city of skyscrapers, huge malls, and staggering amounts of sightseeing. The sand dunes are beautiful, especially as the sun was setting. We did see wildlife, both at the feeding station which allows for good close-up photos and just running amongst the desert foliage. The cultural dinner, entertainment and the camel ride (go around in a circle ) are fun and well done. If I were to do it again, I'd opt for the camel ride outside the reserve fence for a different experience.
Nice Joy Ride!. I enjoyed the fun desert car drive gosh it's like you are in an action movie! can't believe I survive the thrill ride hehehe
Desert delight.... The desert is quiet, locals cool, camels lazy as expected and fun to ride, though short but yeah what the heck

Super Experience. The desert conservation reserve has a boundaty of approximately 93 square kms and the sand is just pure brown and parts of it is a beautiful red. In winters there is desert sand boarding an quad biking but all the year through there are several desert rides, sundownder and overnight stay by arabian adventures, secrets of the desert which covers dune riding, sliding, lots of opportunities to take pictures and see some arabian Oryx and Gazzelles up close. The view is breath taking and there is just acres of sand dunes approximately 225 square kilometers.

Terrible. Not nice, camel ride was literally two steps forward and back again.. Waste of time and sand dunes the size of average uk house and the 4x4 went up and down then for 30 min to get to camp so very travel sick

Something differant but great! buy through dubizzle for cheap deals. The desert safaris are something totally different to the hustle and bustle of dubai and well worth doing. You get an awesome sunset along with different activities, shows and food included. Make sure you check on dubizzle first for a cheaper rate 60-100 AED
Breathtaking.. The beauty of this reserve is overwhelming. The dunes are a kaleidoscope of color and texture, the animal life is breathtaking and the experience is one you won't soon forget.
Amazing. Dubai desert is one of my fav activities there. The peacefulness of the desert, the colors of the sand , the dunes , it is truly a magical mystical place

SURFING THE DESERT. An unforgetable experience surfing the desert in a 4WD.A feel of how the Badwin used to live in the yester years.A wonderful dinner and local show in a tent like environment to experience their life style.Free flow of drinks,henna drawing , delicacies and camel ride for the brave heart. An experience not to be miss!
Remarkable entertain in desert. Unforgotable memories, heaven in desert ride in car jeep in desert, excited riding. Best food, drinks, dance
Drive through the Desert. Driver over the sand dunes was thrilling and at times heart pounding. It was the most superbly organised drive.

Al Jalal Village was great. We did out tour through Viator. We had a hotel pick-up and drop-off, camel ride, ATV, dune bashing, henna and dinner with belly-dancing. Well worth it. At first, our guide made a quick stop for some pics and we thought that was the extent of it. It wasn't. Stay patient. There's so much more.

Dubai Desert. What a wild ride! Not all companies that do this drive are as wild or drive crazy. The level of driving is determined by the people in each ride or maybe by each company driver? The ride also has a cookout later with much entertainment of traditional foods and dances with camels to ride. A great family ride for the afternoon and evening. Do go when its cooler.

A must do!. One of the best evenings spent in dubai! We booked one of the tours and we went to this reserve. We saw a falcon show.. Got to see gazelles up close.. 4x4 drive in the desert.. Watched the sunset.. Camel riding.. Got Hennas.. Had a traditional arabic dinner with arabic music and an oriental dancer.. And we also had some time left for some star gazing.. All the activities needed to give you the right taste of the arabic culture. I would do it again anytime. Well worth the money.

Sundowner. Well worth the money and taking the time to do this. The driver of our car was well experienced and took care ensuring everyone was okay due to the steep sand dounes. Sick bags were available if required as well as water and any questions answered with full explanation. The food at the reserve was amazing and so well organised with lots of other things available, camel riding, henna tattoos shisha and a bell dancer all included in the price. A must do!
Must try. It's nice to go safari in Dubai Desert, enjoy the camel ride, and the dinner with entertainment, also the tattoo henna for girls
Experience not to be missed. This is a must do when visiting Dubai, the sand dunes 4 wheel drive experience,camel ride,and the amazing mealplus belly dancing creating wonderful memories

AMAZING EXPERIENCE. you must do it. It is perfect. jeep are going too fast in the desert and it is an amazing experience. except that you can have an idea of the desert (a few kilometers away from the city) of how people live in the desert and understand their culture. if you can stay the night it will be great. i would defenetely would do it again.

I can't describe it with words. This thrilling and breathtaking experience is a must. The drivers are polite, the surroundings are amazing, an experience of a lifetime! You can snap awesome images and you can ride a camel, get a henna tattoo or hold a falcon. Don't hesitate and book!

Excellent. It was an experience of a life time, from the sand dunes ride, camel ride, diner, tattooing, belly dancing and to top it all the Arabian night... it was spectacular. The sunset was a big plus.
Surprising sight of wildlife. Great to see the animals in what I imagined was an empty desert. Worth taking a good camera to capture the variety of wildlife.

amarzing. Held one of my wishes ( Safari dubai )It all starts aboard jeeps 4 × 4c om air conditioning, into the wilderness making the pick up tourist hotels. Make a small camel ride. Make your engine growl and roar on the sand in an area of dunes free tracks. Enjoy a typical buffet dinner (barbecue Arabic, dates & coffee) served in the open among the tents. Presentation of various art shows with music including Arabic belly dancing and other dances. Try henna tattoo (option for women !!!) lol

A must do experience Desert Safari in Land cruiser car.. Desert Safari is the most important activity in Dubai .It is a must do experience. The Land cruiser car take you in the desert climbing sand dunes with ease . Its a thing to experience . We were shouting all the time when the car was coming down the dunes. Then the camp where dinner is served and the filk dances performed for 2 hours .You can also do camel ride here.

New Exposure and Heritage for all to enjoy .. That was a lot of fun we took the crazy Toyota ride in that desert fast and furious but nice culture and history of the tribes .Night activities are fantastic ,food is fabulous .
Sandy. You'll see plenty of gazelle, a falcon show, ride a camel, and have a day in the desert. Feel like T.E. Lawrence for the day out in the eerily quiet dunes and ever-shifting sands.
Adventurus. Its very Adventurous place to ride in Land criuser in the desert very excited and enjoyed lot thare, With belly dancing and dinner provided by them after that really good.

Adventurous experience !. Great experience, BUT, don't even think about it if you have problems with your back or motion sickness - the only way of getting to the desert is safari drive, we have seen lots of motion sick people))) If you pay a bit more for your trip, it means you going to a better camp with better seats, better dance programme and better dinner.
DESERT. You can say that you have been to Dubai only after you go and see the desert and enjoy some camel rides and belly dancing...
A Grand Night Out. In the late Aftenoon, we went driving through the red sands of the conservation area, and then had a lovely dinner, it was a beautiful tour.

I never tire of looking at the desert and seeing the wild animals. A wonderful resort with a plethora of wild animals and plant life. Activities within the conservation reserve are strictly controlled to enable regeneration of the ecosystem. In the winter months, the views of the Hajar mountains behind the vast expanse of sand is so beautiful.

A taste of life as bedouin. We went on a sand dune 4x4 drive which was exile rating and at times for some scary, but we were always in safe hands. At the end of the drive we went sand boarding which was also great fun as well as a short camel ride. It was all very well organised at a purpose made camp set in the desert surrounded by sand dunes. There was then a dancing show, henna tattoos on offer and a very tasty BBQ dinner. For some adults a shushes were also on offer. All in all a great cultural experience to give a flavour of life in the Middle East. Great value for money!
Must visit. One of the interesting place must visit in Dubai. You can drive a dessert motor bike and try to ride camel.
Nice. Well if you go to the desert you have to ride a camel,, What agreat fun trip you will enjoy the Desert Sunset is beautiful ....

Must Do!. Best experience in Dubai, must do! My family and I got to really live what the culture of the Dubai and the Emirates is really like. Surprisingly the desert is not as hot as the city so we all had an even better time!

Everyone does it so you better not miss it!. The desert safari is good. But I liked the evening program more. Even though it seems a bit touristy, the touch of sand and night air reminds one of the life the desert folks led a century back.

If you've never been on something similar then you'll probably enjoy this.. Trouble with doing a lot of journeying and travelling is that the tourist trips become somewhat similar and after 43 countries there is much less need to go out on such escapades. The journey is bumpy so be careful with your backs. It was still nice to sit out and eat but its all a bit of a gimmick with belly dancing etc. Still the group we were in wrre fun

Just a desert. If you love animals and have never seen the sand dunes this might be worth the trip. Wouldn't bother going on an extended trip out there however. Watch out for car sickness on the dunes if you suffer from it.
A great experience.. great experience staff were great. Food and drink was laid on and a fantastic night well worth the money.
Big fun! Camels and Henna!. Big fun! Camels! Henna! Hookah and darn good food. One of these best adventures. We danced by the fire light and had a great show.

Well worth it. Such an amazing experience, from pick up at our hotel until drop off, you are well taken care of. Definitely worth the money. It involves falcon display, sunset watch, camel riding, henna tattoos, shish, bbq and belly dance display.

Arabian Day to Night. Whatever you do if you come to Dubai don't miss out on the desert safari. Excellent hosts, knowledgeable, skilful all rolled into one evening. The food was good the entertainment great with the belly dancer taking centre stage. Well worth the excursion time. don't forget each picture taken by one of the team adds up at the end of the night you will have difficulty choosing!

Desert of Gulf. After Dune bashing we dropped at for Dinner camp and what a entertainment. Excellent way it is. Only the thing is that it need to be properly managed and cleanliness has to be increased

Desert was delightful. Had a great time in the desert while in Dubai. The driver picked us up from our hotel and then we drove over the other desers where he did some dune bashing. After that, we took photos of the sunset. After we were done taking photos, we rode camels and drove on quad bikes until it was time for dinner. The dinner was huge BBQ with performers, hookah and henna artists. Overall Wonderful! Book with a tour company!

Brilliant day out.. such a brilliant day out here.we went in a jeep crashing over the sand dunes, got henna tattoos, went on camels, ate beautiful food, saw belly dancers.Fantastic day out.well worth every penny.

Lovely experience . Something great to experience when visiting Dubai. The desert is beautiful. The cars itself is a thrilling experience, however our driver was not so pleasant. The belly dancing and food in the middle of the desert made our trip, very authentic and tasty food, great chilling atmosphere

Fun fun fun. Dessert safari was one of the unforgettable adventure i had. The Sand dune make you feel like in a roller coaster but in a air conditioned 4x4 ( crazy fun experience) . The sand ski was cool too. All the traditional arabic food was on the buffet while the magician and belly dancer was performing. The camel ride was awesome! You can try the sisha ( hubbly bubbly) and have a henna tattoo. Its a must when you visit dubai!

Sand everywhere!!!. We were here during the Ramadan, so it was an honour to break the fast with our guides. The place to huge, I would get lost. Was great to see the different animals that had made this their home. Was great to see the Bedouin camp and have and amazing meal.

Place to go in Dubai Desert. We stayed there a couple of times: the organisation and the planification were amazing. Everything was well organized and there was water everywhere and a lot of food. nice pleasure

the four wheel drive dune safari. I did the alf day tour to the desert and find myself in a traffic jam all SVU's driving all together from all the different travel agencies to the same direction until you are switching to a four wheel drive up to eight pasengers, and yes you do get to drive in convoy of up to ten cars over and over up and down the dunes,all the groups do split into their designated areaand once the fun is over you end up into a camp belonging to you specific travel agent,you are alive to beatdown on the ground to watch a fast presented show while you eat your diner once over you are encouraged to purchase goods and then to svu come to take you back to your hotels..did it but would go back againmost operators are indian and not very friendly.

Awesome experience!. This was a highlight of my visit to Dubai. You start by being driven into the desert in an SUV - called dune bashing (beware if you get motion sickness! It's fast and bumpy! But loads of fun!). Then you are taken to the "camp" area where you can do a short camel ride. After that you can go into the campsite where you can browse and/or purchase some stuff - sand art, rugs and clothing, various little souvenirs. There is henna artist and a belly dancer, but for me the most fascinating was the "skirt dance". The buffet meal was pretty decent. Overall a unique and fun experience.

Nature. Visit Dubai and take a trip to the desert safari in order to appreciate nature, hot in the day and warm in the evening. Good meal, Shisha, camel ride and the most fun part of it all is the desert cruise. Lovely experience...

Exhilarating Drive in a desert. Its around 1-1:30 hr travel from the Dubai city. The drive in the desert is very thrilling beware to wear your seat belts. The whole setup where the actual assembly place for all tourist is in the middle of desert. So the evening sunset with gaze of sand winds is something you should experience. The Belly Dance and Kebabs are unique.

A must for dubai. This is a true experience of rustic dubai. The up down jeep drive is entralling. But, for older people and children, it was advised they gently directly hit the camp. At the camp, yo can get a hands on of local souveniers, mehndi - henna art. Watch Belly dancer which is most authentic and tanoura dancer which can be a great surprise. The food and drinks are also good. In thenight, you can watch pure sky with the stars and love gazing !!

Just an average experience. Not far from Dubai centre, but hardly worth it. You see lots of sand dunes, but not wow. Four wheel drive over the dunes is good for first 5 minutes. You see some antelopes, but not much else. The best part of the trip was the small camel farm just outside the centre. Overall we thought the morning was bad value, and we should have gone shopping or stayed around the pool.
Adventure. Spectacular and beautiful is the landscape with camel rides and sand duning which is not for the faint hearted.
Desert Thrills. This was an amazing experience, being driven through the desert in a jeep! I rode a camel for the first time! Best experience and simply a "must-do!"

The best attraction of Dubai. I did an excursion Safari to the desert on a 4 x4 pickup. The dunes are amazing! You see nothing but sand around, just it is supposed to be. The sundowner is really beautiful and special. The Safari included a falcon presentation and a dinner with typical food and a dance show in a camp base. It's a very interesting experience. The best of Dubai in my opinion.

Experience. It was great experience. Reasonable price, food was great and heat was just not tolarable during teh summer, but during November to March it is best. Enjoyed everytime i went and lat one was the 21st time i visited Dubai so you guessed it right :-)

Great Desert Experience. We first had a welcome coffee at the entrance and afterwards had a beautiful sunset, rode camels, held falcons, enjoyed some drinks at their bars and at the end had an excellent buffet dinner and fantastic shows. All in all an experience you will never forget.

Best experience in Dubai. Loved the 4x4 riding in the dunes, great pictures, living in the desert. Made it to the camp, did some off road ATV, camel riding. Saw a great spectacle. Food was ok but who is complaining.

Adventure. Really nice "Desert experience"!! We saw different species and the sunset is amazing!
The reserve is definitely worth seeing!

The one thing you must do!. We travelled out to the conservation park and onto a night desert safari and it was one of the most unique experiences I've had in over 14 countries. My adult and teenage children also really enjoyed it. Pay for a reputable tour company, you get what you pay for in this experience. We watched falcon flying, went 4x4 driving (we are Aussies who own 4x4's back home and go constantly 4x4 driving and still enjoyed this experience), watched the sunset, rode camels and spent time in a absolutely wonderful desert camp. They turned the lights off in camp to see the sky, and coming from Australia we are used to beautiful nighttime star gazing and this was easily equal to that. Loved everything.....

So excited!. It's so excited experience for me . Driving at desert was almost like roller coaster! My mother was not good at such kind of activity though, she also enjoyed . I still remember sun set i saw standing smooth sands. Which was i've never felt living in japan. I also tried henna art while staying at that place , I think it will be popular among girls because of its beautification.I wanna visit there again.

Desert trip. Very fun and interesting to make a trip out. Choose one that is not too costly and of course not expect too much for the food. But the sand dune ride was fun, not to be missed, quite a pleasurable experience, must bring along sun glasses else your pictures will not turn out nice
Desert, may spot some wildlife. I enjoyed our visit, we saw some deer which was great. Driving over the sand hills was exciting! I would recommend a visit.

A day/night to remember. under the arabian sky with food and wine flowing. Dancer to entertain and the BBQ was amazing. Take a 20 meters walk to the dunes to watch the sunset. no words to describe how majestic it is. Very much a good day out and something to rememeber
Definite Go To Place. Amazing experience. Must try activity in Dubai. Avoid Friday's as you would miss "Belly Dance" show. Being a veggie, I loved the dinner which was served at night.
wow. i love everything about the Desert Safari, the jeep ride , the dancers, the camel ride was wow. Can't wait till i come dubai and go for safari again.

Great place to visit, book with reputable tour operator. Visited the desert conservation, great experience, beautiful pictures and great time!!!!
Would highly recommend booking with reputable tour operator, used Platinum Heritage, it was incredible.
Great time, highly recommend for ALL AGES.

Worth seeing. It was a fun night being picked up at hotel and taken to a central point where we were put in jeeps for the desert trip. Dinner in a tent with entertainment was fun. We did not eat the grilled camel but enjoyed riding one! If you go, don't forget to look up at the stars!

Desert Overnight stay. They were very professional and were willing to cater to our needs at short notice. They were excellent with our children (6, 9 & 11) and we felt comfortable at all times. Well worth paying the extra. An experience not to be missed.
Amazing. What a truly beautiful place! The dunes were very gently rolling and the whole atmosphere was one of pure serenity.

My favorite part of Dubai. We saw the reserve by staying at Al Maha, but you can arrange for tours. The wildlife is very interesting, the birds songs are intoxicating, and the desert landscape is still and beautiful. There are trees that grow slowly and are around 400 years old, with deep root systems. And, if you have time, you can ride a camel or go dune bashing just outside of the reserve. If I could only see one place again in Dubai, it would be the desert. Lovely.

Unforgetable experience!!. We had unbelievable, extreme safari with jeep through the desert (Thank you driver)， camel riding, sandboarding, falconry display, banquet, dinner-show involvement and a henna tattoo on my arm. It was worth it.

Desert Dune Ride. The desert is incredibly beautiful, and the ride through the dunes was exciting. We saw oryx (one of 4 antelope species native to the Arabian Peninsula) camels, a falconry demonstration and ate dinner under the stars in a Bedouin tent.

So awesome to see!. This was my first time in an actual desert and it was beautiful, and so vast!Loved seeing the wild gazelles and oryx, and learning more about how people used to live in the desert. Such an awesome landscape. And the reserve is great because it offers protection to all the wildlife.Definitely something to see when in the area!

Can~t go to Dubai without visiting the desert. The Desert Safari tour is mandatory during your stay in Dubai. It is very well organized and provides beautiful and different scenery. The 4x4 dunes experience is good, as well as the camel riding and dinner at a camp make this tour a very unique and unforgettable experience.

Reclamation for consolidation. Engineering application, environmental package and good housekeeping culture. To ensure protection and prevention of desert adversity to human existence. To turn it a world attraction.

Funny experience. It was a funny experience riding camels, if you forget the smell of them. But the most breathtaking experience was 4x4 safari with jeep. Dont miss it . The landscape has the color of light orange all around you as far as you can see. Late in the afternoon the tepmerature was low ( during day was 45 and in the desert at night was 20 C) Also included the barbeque by night the food was quite spice , there were dancers in the center of the village.
