Must see landscape. Go in the morning and enjoy the vast desert, the quiet and the animals. The oryx - white antilopes with parallel long black horns - look amazing. Great photo opportunities.
Great fun. Have roller coaster ride on sand dunes. Amazing experience of sunset in desert, riding on sand dunes, night camp, camel ride etc etc

The Ultimate Desert Experience. This was a highlight for me. I loved riding the dunes with a driver who knew exactly how to manoeuvre his vehicle in the desert condition. I can't wait to go again. The meal was good and entertainment at the Oasis was of top qualityA very sad sight was the litter(and a lot of it, widely spread) we found at one of our stops. The thought that the litter problem could grow is a BIG worry for me. No traveller wants to see litter to that extent and especially in such a beautiful spot

Serenity. Our small tour of 6 took us to the Arabian Desert inside Dubai. The beauty of this unique desert and it's natural habitat made for a relaxed and serene retreat from the city. What struck me most was the quiet. Absolutely still. There was desert wild life everywhere, but quickly scattered away when humans approach. We enjoyed a boxed lunch sitting on a Persian rug while our guide explained the desert and culture of it's people. A wonderful experience. Oh yes. There are camels.

Unusual rides. This was the experience I wanted when I came to Dubai. The dunes ride was exciting; up and down, dune after dune in a four-by-four, thinking the vehicle would turn over, but the driver was very skilled at this. The highlight was the opportunity to ride a camel. I've never experienced anything like this before, but it was the ride of a lifetime. I REALLY enjoyed this attraction. Having dinner in the desert, watching the whirling dervish, the belly dancer -- it was Fantastic!!!

time pass. though i had heard a lot about the desert safari.. All my hopes were crashed.. the cruiser experience in the desert was just average. The food, the programs, were all just an average performance.

Must. Land curiser with desert ride is worth, try buggy ride only if you can spend nothing great, the food at the mid desert gathering is too bad shows are a good try the free hookah around the cornor

Great ride on the dunes.. but bad food!. My husband and I went for the desert safari tour in March - a good month to be in Dubai after all in terma of weather! The ride on the dunes was perhaps the best part of the tour. But be careful do not each much just before heading for the bumpy ride, you could end up in nausea and vomiting (like the other couple who we shared the car with). You can click some amazing photos and enjoy a good evening the arabic style with some awesome dance performances. I give thid tour a 3 rating because : 1. Though its called the desert conservation park, you can see litter around! 2. the food at the camp was horrible with limited veg options 3. Its quite commercialized and touristy place, so if you are looking for a natural experience of the desert or some off-beat things to do in Dubai, you should strike this off.
Its a Most!. Great tour, beautiful landscapes, sunset at the desert! Lots of oportunities for great pictures, camel rides and dinner at the dunnes!
Desert Rose. Reminded me so much of Sting's song "Desert Rose". Amazing views and Amazing Serenity. You just have to sit back and see the endless sands and dunes!!! Admiration guaranteed
Such a great place!. Highly highly recommend going here. It was so fun and interesting! Get to see wild animals - I got to see a wild owl! I've never seen that before, let alone in the desert.

A Tranquil Place in the Desert. A great conservation area. Bird life at all the ponds and a small lake.
You can enjoy the site on a bicycle during cool weather from late September till early April. The track runs along the reserve.

Wonderful. Well worth the drive. A great conservation area. Bird life at all the ponds and small lake. Stay on the correct roads or I imagine you could get stuck in the sand. We were told you can also camp overnight. Abundant animal tracks leading to and from the watering holes.

Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve. We went only for the sunset and was well organized. The dinner was a bit expensive, but worth every money spent.
If you there, do not miss this out.
Early morning Wildlife Safari and Bedouin Breakfast. Very professional. Collected us on time. Guide had a wealth of knowledge. Very relaxed fun filled morning. Highly recommend it.
Nice experience. An experience to drive through the desert by four-wheel drive. Some animals in the area with a photo opportunity - nice.

When in Dubai... You have to experience the desert and what better way than a few hours of dune bashing, sandboarding and camel riding! The dune bashing was a thrilling experience, one I have never had the opportunity to do before, the drivers of the land cruisers are super skilled, whizzing their vehicles through the dunes. The camel riding was so much fun, albeit short.

Beautiful untouched sands of the dessert. Just the beautiful, visibly untouched rolling sandy dunes of this dessert are worth the visit. The rest is a bit artificial, the onplanted animals for instance. However. This is still one of the most genuin "attractions" of Dubai today.

Awesome experience in the Dubai desert. We went for 'dune bashing' in 4x4 vehicles which was great and hair raising followed by sand boarding before watching spectacular sunset over the dunes. Ended off with a traditional dinner in the desert with local cuisine and dancing. Great experience which I can highly recommend. Many companies does same sort of excursions.
A great place. The place is great, the safari experience is also a very nice experience and one must attempt, not for the faint hearts, but the other motor sports around are equally fascinating.
an animal experience. I wanted to see Arabian Oryx and Arabian gazelle which I saw and enjoyed searching over the red sand dunes for them
Loved it!. Once you are in Dubai - Desert Safari is a must experience! Book a car, take ur friends and let them take u for a ride! It's 100% a lovely adventure.
Wellkept. I was lucky to get an access here and saw orix and also experiences the sunset.its just great to be there.
OK. An ok visit not what we expected a few plants but they would not be there naturally the miles of hoses watering them gives that away interesting but not that interesting
Very cool. You wouldn't expect the desert to be quite so interesting, but there's quite a bit going on out there. And some time away from the malls and city was well worth it.

EXCITING PLACE TO VISIT. It is where the 4WD adventures takes place, but the company provides food for the desert dwelling animals (gazelles, birds)
It is a peaceful and natural place both for humans and wildlife

Hot and beautiful. Did you know that planting trees in the desert can change the climate and produce some rain? Well, the Dubai desert reserve is just doing that, apart from looking after fauna and flora you wouldn't want to miss out on as a traveller. Treat yourself or your partner/family to something special by staying at the Al Maha resort. We just loved it there.
Where life, live is. The reserve is a beauty, a wonderfull experience. Becoming one with nature, sitting down a let the nature taking over.

A real Arabian Night Adventure. is a child in all of us that is always in pursuit of an adventure. Somewhere exciting to go and experience something new and fun. Sinbad, Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves, 1001 Arabian Nights are all tales made us dream of our own Arabian Nights adventure. The adventure that most may think of when coming to Arabia is to live like the Bedouins; in the desert and a tent, living with camels, and nights around the campfire telling stories and enriching ourselves with the culture of the people.  When coming to the UAE, there is a chance to live this adventure at the Bassata Desert Village in the vast and pristine desert of Ras al Khaimah. This is a modern luxurious version of the adventure so you’ll be pampered while experiencing the Bedouin lifestyle for the evening.   The experience begins with welcome of snacks and tea and then you are escorted to your tent. You’ll be there with other adventurers and you’ll sit on the floor on pillows and carpets. The tents are made from camel hair and are the same tents used by the Bedouin people for thousands of years. But this facility is not the form or fashion from those years gone by. It is new and modern and a project supported by the Ras Al Khaimah government. The bathrooms and common areas are what you would find in a luxury resort. Around the sides there are various vendors selling crafts, souvenirs, and local items. There is a central facilities area with a fully stocked bar and a serving area for the feast, suitable for a Sultan, that you are about to experience.   In the center of the vast open space is a floor with pillows and table where some of the guest choose to sit. Other’s retreat to the tents on the knoll where there is an unobstructed view of the floor below.   As we settle in, our host checks in on us to see how we are doing and to tell us a bit more about the experience. All the staff are dressed in Bedouin attire and with a friendly smile he bid us marhaba or welcome and asked us where we were from. Most of the staff here are from the Middle East or Northern Africa and such places as Morocco and Egypt.   It is February when we are here and in the desert at night is chilly. Our Bedouin host ask if we have everything we need. He brings a blanket for us that adds a little romance to the evening as we sip wine and cuddle under the covers as the candles flicker on the tables around the tent.   The night we arrived there were families, couples and small groups in attendance. I hear German, Dutch, Russian, Hindu, and Arabic spoken. They venture out to various areas of the camp taking camel rides and there are ladies getting henna on their hands and feet. Some tourists dress up as Arabs to Facebook and instagram their pictures for soon to be jealous friends and family back home. Some people are at the bar enjoying a refreshing libation.   While all the festivities are going on, an army of white-coated cooks and chefs hurry about to prepare the feast. You know that you are in for something special as you see the preparations take place with serving trays and dishes being put in place.   Off to the side there is a massive grill and the flames from the charcoal sizzle the meats and spread the aroma about the camp. The call for dinner goes out and the readied guests make their way to the buffet. This is an Arabic Barbeque and the food is delicious and plentiful with too many choices to name. Beef, lamb, chicken and fish as well as various salads, vegetables side dishes, and desserts are on the menu each night. We take our trays back to our tent and have a thoroughly enjoyable meal chatting with other couples nearby in our tent.   After dinner, just as the inevitable drowsiness from over eating sets in, they raise the tiempo with the entertainment. In the central floor/stage area the spotlights come on and the talent enters the stage. Many of the guests leave the comfort of their tent to move closer at the tables around the stage area for a closer look or to take more jealousy inducing Facebook photos.   First up is the belly dancer. It’s a bit chilly out but she doesn’t not seem to mind as she winds and gyrates around the floor. Her body seems to move without a spine as she moves in every direction. The audience is mesmerized with her shaking and shimmering.   Next up is the Egyptian Tanoura dancer. I cannot understand how he is able to do what he does. Basically he twirls in one direction at a frantic pace for 30 minutes. As he twirls, his costume begins to “fly’ with each twist higher and higher. He begins to juggle various objects and layers of his costume become part of his props as he then lifts over his head. All of this while the music in the back grounds drums and trumpets in a frenzy matching his pace. By now he’s sweating and is moving as intensely as the music. Any other mortal on the planet would have collapsed from dizziness after five minutes. For his finale, the spotlights on him go dark and with a flash, his costume lights up. It looks like a Christmas tree is caught in a tornado as the music intensifies and he twirls even faster. When the tiempo is a peak and he twirling is at a ridiculous pace with a sharp drumbeat he collapses and the music halts. Wow.   After a robust applause from the amazed onlookers, he picks out a guest from the audience. She joins him on stage and he puts his costume on her. She begins to twirl while laughing and talking to her friends in Russian. The costume begins to rise but she then falls and all join her with laugher.   After the entertainment is done, we go back to our tent to relax a bit while talking about the exciting evening that we just experienced. It was a wonderful time. Some of the guest will stay the night and wake to a deluxe breakfast. We decide to call it a night and return home.   There are many companies providing various types of dessert safaris. The Bassata Desert Village has taken the experience and made it a five star evening with their delicious Arabian barbeque, the deluxe facilities, the service, and the entertainment. If you seek to enjoy the Arabian nights adventure you always dreamed of as a child, Bassata Dessert Village in Ras Al Khaimah is the way to do it in style.

Wonderful place to experience the dessert. The DDCR is a unique way to experience the dessert. It is literally teaming with gazelle and Arabian Oryx.The environment varies from larger to smaller sand dunes to areas full of vegetation where you'll find many of the animals. Admitedly the areas with higher levels of flora are only possible due to the high level of man made irrigation provided but I guess that's fitting for an attraction near Dubai.The government has devoted 5% of the total land of Dubai to the DDCR and it is a special treat to visit it.
Desert safari. We had a great day in the conservation reserve on our desert safari. Lots of animals to see and some dunebashing along the way. Great day out and a must for everyone.

Desert safari visit marvellous trip. Camel camel camel riding .my kids r crying with pleasure now I am in daska Pakistan but not I am feeling myself in desert safari v good gathering music buffet dinner .jeep driving such enjoyable .most liked activity in dubai by my kids.evning sunset scenery cool winds .this was the different style of life .the person who danced so much lights was v enjoyable arabic songs.

A Great Desert Experience. We booked our tour through one of the many companies online and they picked us up and dropped us off at our hotel. We booked a short morning tour but that was more than enough for us. After a short ride to the reserve we took off across the dunes. We saw some desert wildlife and stopped often for pictures. Refreshments were available for our tour, but others include camel rides, lunch, dinner, and other things. We paid less than 400 AED for our tour for two and had a great time overall. After a late night out the night before the 9 am pickup was not bad but some of the 4x4 action had some effect on our stomachs. The driver slowed down and took things easy as he saw we were having some trouble. Highly recommend as a great trip to escape the city of Dubai.
Experiance the desert. The dance of noora was really good and very refreshed performance. which is totally familiar and amazing

A safe experience in the desert. If you want a semi-authentic experience in the desert, without losing any comfort, this is the place for you. You start with a falcon show, the a tour by the dunes on a 4 by 4, with or without emotion (if you get car sick, watch out). The you watch the sunset over the dunes, and finally a camel ride and dinner by the Bedouin fire, with a Belly dance show to entertain.I enjoy it a lot.On a side note, wait for the bathroom at the diner place. Trust me.

Amazing. We visited the conservation reserve with Arabian Adventures to go dune bashing and saw a number of deers and oryx during our adventure. Its certainly worth visiting if only to appreciate it the vastness of the desert.
visit the desert. it is great ride for all family. kids love it! don´t go if you are motion sickness sensible!! the sun goes out and the fun starts up!. i would never miss it

Bravo. When you drive 38 miles away from Dubai, you begin to realize what existed here before the economic and building boom. The protected desert reserve is home to native wildlife, including gazelles, and it is very special for tourists to see this. Hopefully this on-going effort to protect a vast area of desert will benefit the environment, save the native species, and educate the public about the importance of this conservation project.

Dubai's extraordinary desert: A unique experience!. Visiting Dubai's desert was a fantastic and unforgettable experience. You can visit Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve while staying at the fabulous Al Maha Desert Resort & Spa, or by booking the tours offered by authorized agents. The activities organized by Al Maha's rangers are really amazing, allowing travelers to go deep into this oasis of fauna, flora and wildlife preservation. I booked only four activities: 1) Sunset camel ride - ending on the desert dunes, enjoying the sunset, sipping champagne and tasting the fantastic dates of Dubai. Shazzab and Darryn, the camel masters, will help you lose any hard feelings you might have against camels; 2) Early morning falconry - how can one miss this Arabian secular tradition? Brad, the falcon master, will bring falcons to your arm safely and you'll even caress them; 3) 4x4 Desert drive - extreme, intense and memorable, with beautiful dunes and the great desert scenery. Dwayne, a South African ranger, born and raised in the Kalahari Desert, will demonstrate all his skills driving on high dunes - please no eating before the ride and nerves of steel are a must; and 4) Wildlife drive - a quiet and amazing drive within the DDCR - Ranger Lihandra will give you a chance to photograph the rare Omani white oryx and many other desert animals. Enjoy!

Extraordinary Experience in the dessert. It was a extraordinary experience by taking the four wheels drive into the dessert. We stopped at one point to view the sunset in the dessert while appreciate the champaign, it's simply BEAUTIFUL! Even feeling the sand on your feet is an awesome, as it's so soft, tiny and smooth :-)The night ended by indulging in the arabic music with belly dancing perfomance, not forgetting chilling out with friends. It's a lifetime experience.

Beautiful landscape not much wildlife. We entered the reserve as part of a desert safari. The landscape is gorgeous but I love the desert too so may be a bit partial. I was a tad bit disappointed that we did not see any antelopes and only saw a couple of gazelles. Maybe just bad timing. It is worth a visit though if just for the landscape. A more accurate rating is "good" but the way TA does it 3 = average and 4= very good. It is better than average and verging on very good.

Sundowner Dune Dinner/Desert Safari. We did a Sundowner Dune Dinner tour which was fantastic. We did some thrilling dune bashing along with many others in Toyota Landcruisers. We took some wonderful photos of the setting sun and then drove to our Bedouin encampment for camel rides, shisha, henna painting, beautiful food, wine and belly dancing. We also saw a falcon up close and watched the owner training it. We had a very memorable night and purchased some photos of our camel ride.
beautiful. This conservation area is beautiful at dusk and sundown. Animals roaming about, beautiful sand dunes, lovely colors come out in the evening.
Perfect peace. The best way to get up close and personal with the wildlife, whilst enjoying your very own infinity pool
Spectacular experience!. the landscape is unique the tranquility is superb, then the endemic animals of the area, plus the top quality resorts and cuisine its a simple experience to die for!

Great Fun. The Dubai Desert is beautiful and the desert safari 4x4 drive was excellent. Show after safari and dune biking is great. Food is good and activities are nice. Just that you have to be quick in taking your food.

Great fun!!. Modern, air conditioned 4x4 with a knowledgable and safe driver. Dune bashing, sunset watching, photo ops and that's before we get to our beautifully set up camp. Good food, drinks and sheesha. And an optional camel ride I you like.
Something different. This was good experienceSand dune in 4x4 funHot to ride buggy in sandFood in dessert was o.k.Weather was good for this in October
good experience. The food and entertainment were good- if you get motion sickness though I wouldn't recommend the sand-dune four wheel driving!!
Desert Safari FUN FUN FUN!. Amazing unique experience if you are traveling to UAE don’t miss it. Especially dune drive it’s a crazy fun.
Desert. I like the way they appreciate the idea of recycling the water, yet keeping it so natural. Being in the middle of a desert, water is a very precious commodity, therefore it must be preserved.

Amazing. This was one of the highlights of my stay. You get picked up from the hotel and they drive through the desert for a while along with 20 or so other cars. It can be really bumpy so not so great for younger kids. You see the sunset, ride camels and then have lunch under the stars while a belly dancer dances to arabic music. Eventful to say the least!

Arabian nights. The Dubai Desert has really breathtaking sights and scenery such as the peak of a sand dune where the sand is so soft and cooling when we roamed the desert near to evening time. Enjoying the food and drinks under the glittering stars is really romantic as well as being able to experience Arabic traditional arts, like intricate henna tattoos and unusually beautiful sand art creations where customizing the message you would like to carry across to your loved ones.

Stunningly beautiful. Well worth a trip. The falcon show is a bit tacky but the sand dune driving is amazing and the dunes at sunset are very very beautiful. The dinner at the camp is great value for money. Recommended

Hot night in the desert. We thought the sand dune part of the trip was great however the dinner was very average. The seating was a cushion on the ground - very difficult to get down to and quite uncomfortable - what do you do with your legs? Hard if you are not young and supple! I didn't like the fact that we were expected to cover shoulders and knees out of respect for the local culture but the entertainment was a belly dancer in typical belly dancer outfit! She was very good but would have been better if there had been 3 or 4 dancers rather than just one. The drive back to our hotel was a nightmare with the driver going 150klm per hour - and I was in the front seat! Obviously he needed to get home in a hurry :-) Tip: wear sandals not sneakers as the sand is very fine and fills your shoes.
Desert Safari - must do!. Booked a Desert Safari as a couple - not really knowing what to expect - would do it again! Fantastic experience.
A great reserve. Wonderful to see that the authorities were foresighted enough to preserve and restore the desert area with the original animals flora and fauna and maintain it in pristine condition
excellent adventure. its a well plan interesting adventure nice staffs. the dinner was beautiful with all the shows. it was nice watching the sunset from the desert

a great night out. we had a great night at the safari even if we did not do the dunebashing. just the camel ride, photos with the falcon and then the shows, belly dancing, the spinning guy is amazing, the buffet in the desert. a must do even if it is a little touristy. a great sunset and worth the small climb up the hill.
worth seeing. Visited here as part of our desert safari. We saw some onyx, gazelles and lizards. Worth a visit as part of a tour.

Dune Dinner Safari. Doing tour such as the Dune Dinner Safari is a must, great way to have an Arabic experience. Pick up and drop off at hotels, food was great, included soft drinks and alcohol, shisha smoking, camel rides, henna and belly dancing.
high tea. we went there booking for a high tea. we had 3 courses, a tea and a cocktail. we remained astonished by the internal fountain

Loved the desert at night !. I visited as part of a "dinner safari" to a "Bedouin Camp". The higlight of the trip was not the dune ride, or the dinner, or the touristy entertainment (belly dancer, fortune teller, camel ride, etc) but just being in the desert. We arrived as the sun was setting, and the temperature cooled from about 95 F to maybe in the 70s, and breezy. (wear trousers and sand-proof shoes !) Our dunes were not as dramatic as they are in some parts of the Reserve, but they were beautiful - quiet, mysterious, and fun to walk a ways out to feel what it would have been like to try to navigate. I am so glad that this part of the desert is preserved from development for us all to see.

Roller Coster in Desert. I have been there so many times. I love to visit this site more and more. Its fun to visit by seating in Land Cruiser roller coster. If your driver is experienced enough, you will really love this ride.

Wild ride. Definitely recommended for those who like wild rides. There are many companies around who offer a desert safari but only a few of them are recognised by the Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve. Visit their website to know what company to go for.

dubai dessert. not sure if they do during the morning but was afternoon we went was a great time after been driving round the dessert in jeep we went for some entertainment and drinks after and rides on the cammell a must to try we had great time finished at 8pm

execellent. we booked it from Melbourne cause it dose get booked out really fast and your food and drinks are all for free ..you will love it I hate rides but this was Amazing will do it again ..you can get your hand panted with hena and have a camel ride and take photos a lot to do in about 8hrs ...you will never know if you don't give it ago !!!

An evening of ups, downs and sideways. The ride to the desert reserve was an exciting surprise.We flew over down and around the dunes thinking we were going to turn over. What an adrenalin rush.This was followed by a bar-be cue dinner with a belly dancer.Camel rides were also available for thows who wanted more thills.I had big fun but this was not a good experience for people pron to motion sickness.

Desert Trip. Cheesy Touristy Fun!
If you get travel sick - take some medicine before doing the dune rides! A one time must do.

Desert Safari is an excellent and thrilling experience. I am not sure whether the place that I visited was the Desert Conservation Reserve. As it is organized by the tour, I was transferred from the hotel in the late afternoon to reach the desert. The driver did not speak much and immediately put me into the 4-wheels drive. The dune bashing is starting immediately after the Arabic driver drove into the desert. It is excellent like the playing roller coaster in the desert. You will be able to watch sunset in the desert by climbing to the sand dune. Climb up is difficult to climb down. The sand is too soft.Camel riding and sand boarding are chargeable separately.The BBQ dinner was served but this is really a simple BBQ as only BBQ chicken is served. Other courses are mainly vegetarian.The most impressive and attractive were the Tanoura dance and Belly dance. It is amazing that the Tanoura dancers can spin more than 15 minutes without feeling dizzy.Overall, it is an unforgettable and irregretable trip to the desert. Everyone shall visit desert once upon a time in your life.

Breathtaking!. I love the ocean, but this was my first experience in an ocean of sand. The desert is beautiful and serene and I applaud the Conservation Reserve in protecting this incomparable ecosystem.

Dune ride was great, but camel ride was short and fast. I was disappointed.. I do agree with others about Dubai. Desert experience took my breath away. I think it was one of the most exciting things in Dubai.

Conservation Wonder. Nature lovers will appreciate Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve as they experience its beauty for themselves. The native fauna was amazing as I saw species I never seen or heard of before. The staff were friendly and willing to answer questions which made my adventure a truely memorable one. I would highly recommend people visit the conservation wonder and embrace its secrets for themselves.Caroline B

Very exciting desert safari. The whole period from the time we were picked from our hotel by a comfortable 4X4 safari vehicle at around 4 pm till we were dropped back at 10:30 pm, I and my wife had a lovely time. Once we entered the desert park, It started with a falcon show which followed the real thing. Driving up n down the sand dunes,our vehicle skidding at times, tilting by huge degrees, blasting up sand in the air, it was all very exciting. Driving skills of our driver on the sand were commendable. There were total of 50 vehicles doing the same stuff and it all look exciting. This followed a lovely sun downer experience which meant we watched the sun set behind the sand dunes while it was getting cooler by every moment.Then we were taken to the base camp which was a lovely set up. Food, dance, drinks, camel ride, with dunes in the background made fo a spcial evening.

Once in a lifetime!. A Trip to the Middle East without visiting the great Arabian Desert.... what a complete loss!! Yes, the Desert is one attraction that one should never & cannot miss at the cost of other attractions. The Conservation Reserve is a piece of area in the Desert where civilians are permitted to visit and roam freely without any restrictions. This is the same area where all the Desert Safari's are also done i.e. Sand bashing in the 4x4 land cruisers including the night camps.Since it is very difficult to see the desert on your own because of the terrain and permission issues one should book a safari wherein one can really experience the desert first hand. There is sand everywhere and the sunset is a delight to watch overlooking the desert. You can find people from neighboring emirates (Sharjah, Ajman etc) visiting the Dubai Desert over the weekends in their convoy of vehicles to enjoy the desert experience very frequently.Make sure to book with a good tour operator as this is one real experience which is equally thrilling and memorable and should be done with a good experienced driver only..
beautiful desert. i really enjoyed it .. first off road then dinner .. tho it was very cold at night.. nice show but why a blond and western belly dancer in the middle of the desert !!!!

Do it yourself. We did the desert thing but didn't book a trip. Went off in two land rovers and did it independently. Saw a couple of wild camels which was pretty good.But, it's just sand at the end of the day and Dubai is very ho so I wasn't gong to get too excited. We parked up, fried up some bacon n eggs, took some photos, had a look around, got a flat tyre, changed the tyre which made us sweat like we had never sweated before , drove up and down the dunes and then left sweating and dirty and with soaking wet shirts. It's alright. Maybe the trips are more entertaining but I wouldn't know. While in Dubai, it's worth seeing but it can be stupidly hot and it's not amazing.

The desert.... Oh, the desert. You have to love it. This is not for the faint hearted adn don't expect much comfort. It's the desert. No air conditioning there. But if you can take a bit of sand and heat, the sheer beauty of it would pay you back a thousand times...

Well Run Conservation Programme. The principles that underpin the reserve are founded on sound ecological practice - the mix of species and levels of habitat management intervention are carefully finessed and great progress is being made in establishing representative habitats of the region. Whilst the open water lake is probably an intervention too far, it does provide an additional ecological niche... An excellent outing and a break from the commercialisms of downtown Dubai.

NICE. Had a wonderful Desert Safari with Dune Dinner, very well arranged trip, Driver picked us on time from hotel had a 35 min drive to reach the spot, Beginned with Falcon Watch, and had a wonderful drive in between car will stop for photographs and sunset, after sun set had a wonderful drink and dinner finally show will end with belly dance,

A Must to try in Dubai!. Very good experience! The journey to the desert is about 30~40 min. Along the way, the driver will stop for toilet break. In the desert the 4x4 car bashing through the desert. Very thrilling and entertaining. Looking at the sunset at the desert, taking photos, went to the camp for camel riding and dinner. Overall very good experience! A must when visit Dubai!

Finally the wildlife of this area is being protected. When I first got here in the sixties, wildlife was hunted with helicopters and machine guns. Within a very short space of time, wildlife had almost totally disappeared. Sheiklh Zayed started the ball rolling with trying to save the Arabian Oryx in Al Ain and from then on the conservation of many species as well as large tracts of desert was enforced. Thankfully the hunting of wildlife is now banned and just last weekend I saw two sand gazelles. The first ones I had ever seen.

Desert camping under the stars. I recently spent a night camping here as part of my sons cub scouts of America program.We arrived early in the morning(8am), parked at a secure sand car park where our gear was transferred into the DDCR 4x4. A few minutes later we arrived at our location for the next 24 hrs and set up camp. The facilities were not as I expected- a large majlis area with low seating, extensive buffet food offerings, clean (ish) bathrooms.Included in our camping adventure was :A dune bashA visit to Sheik Mohammad's private lake to see lots of animals up close.A talk by a nature specialistFalcon showCamel ridesGenerous and tasty Arabic buffet dinnerStar gazingCooked breakfastOverall,we were there for 24hrs and it was thoroughly enjoyable- even for this five star princess!

Best trip through the desert ever!. Don't miss this, if you think you've seen a desert you haven't seen Dubai Desert. There's some really exotic and yet intoxicating about the desert view. When you go through, don't rush - take your time to absorb the breeze (during October best time to go) and let the sand seep through fingers. You'll also see some wild desert animals - try and spot the white Oryx. Absolutely beautiful!

Desert Safari rocks. It was a summer evening, yet we didn't mind the humidity in the air. That safari ride was just awesome. After some photo shoots in the desert, we went straight to the bedouin camp. We had kebabs, arabian dinner there, then watched some belly dancing and local dances. It was a good cultural experience.
Beautiful! Unique! Special!. We loved spending time out in the desert. It was such a unique place for us to be and learn about. Highly recommended!
HUGE fun. Wadi bashing is a blast! And at the end you get supper in a camp in the desert. Sure, it's a bit contrived, but as close as you'll get to the real thing.
Ride and slide. If you just want to spend half a day on tour this may be an option. Nice guide, camel riding and sand boarding, if you want to.
amazing. well worth the money as the experience is unique and lots of extras such as henna painting, belly dancing, snow boarding, camel rides etc

Great sandy fun. Great fun, even if some got car sick friom driving in the dunes. The drivers were very skilled. We ended with BBQ dinner at a tentsite in the desert where they also had all kinds of activities including an amazing dance show featuring a dancer with many layers of colourful skirts going around and around as well as a skilled bellydancer. Some of us dressed up in Arab costumes, great photo opportunities! Only regret was that we did not have time to ride camels, it was getting dark. This was a typical "tourist trap", but still a great way to relax away from meetings and work.

Fantasic. However you get there there will be lots of people. Try to get a little way away from the crowds and you can feel like you are on your own. Look for the other wild life bile you are there you will see some.

Great night out. We had a terrific time on this adventure. Saw wild life, 4xwheel sand dune drive was fun, Fazel our guide was excellent and camel ride, meal, belly dancer, henna tattooing and star gazing added something special to the night. great fun....

Must do !. I had red a lot about the Dubai desert before I landed. I took this via my tour operator at 65 EUR/person including transportation, dune bashing, great food. It's one of the greatest funs that you could have in Dubai. Enjoy....

Evening in the desert. If you tend to be carsick, ask to ride in the front when they reach the conservation area! Very bumpy - but fun.Restroom/toilet facilities are available...cleanliness about what you should expect out in the desert.Food, excellent. Lots of choice. Well-cooked and nicely presented.belly dancers...typical - what made us chuckle was that the lead dancer was actually Brazilian; the other three dancers were her students, and not one of them was from the UAE!A good touristy night out...fun if you don't focus on the authenticity!
Dinner in the desert. Everything! riding the dunes, watching the sun set over the desert, camel ride, holding a falcon, dinner, fun photos taken it was brillant.

a bit of desapoitment. the desert was beautiful experieiced, but the camp was very poorly organised for my taste.i hated to see cans of cola and things one can buy in a western supermarket... i expected a more realistic taste of arabian culture..
Desert Safari. Good to chill out in the evening with the bbq dinner, had hema done on my hand, and the desert was good for sightseeing

Arabian Adventure Dinner and Dune safari. Lots of fun burning over the dunes, but might pay to take a travel sickness pill as after half an hour your tummy may start getting a bit churned up ! They do several stops including one at sunset for photos. You can have a camel ride at the beginning before going over the dunes including a photo but you can also take your own photo - need to be quick though as they move you along quickly probably so you cant take your own photos and they can make money. The setting for the dinner was very authentic with big comfy pillows to sit on and low tables, there are also some higher tables. Food was authentic and lovely too. Camels here for rides also but not so good for photos as it is dark. Be warned it will be very hot, no airconditioning, it was 40 degrees at 6.30 pm when we were there in September. The locals said that December is the best month to visit, but gets cold in the desert at night apparently

Have to try it!. I had never experience driving through a dessert and it was amazing!!! highly recommend it. The tour I took included dinner with belly dancers, buffet style food, hena, camels...and so on....very touristy, which I typically do not enjoy as much but I've learned that tourist entertainment and how activities are put together is also part of the culture...I had a really good time. The food was not good but not bad either...

paying 500 dhirams for a 15 mins drive is not worth it. guys the drive to the safari was too good it was jst awesome expect tht don'nt expect more .......worthless food they make u stand in a line like beggers the food is so bad tht i can'nt even write it down .....belly dance and all is good the place is worth visiting only during dec.....
A great get away place from the city of Dubai. Went up and down dune after dune in a four by four, the sand colours and sun set are well worth seeing

Enjoy Desert. Desert safari is a must to do in Dubai trip. It take one entire evening. If you have nusia from ups and down then it is not for you. It gives an experience as in roller caster. The end of trip is full enjoy with belly dance and lots of food.
Rocking. Visited the desert through the dune dinner safari. It was an awesome experience. Watched the falcon show and saw a few animals, of which camel. Luckily, it didn't get too hot

An exciting experience. The trip Starts in the evening. Going to desert with a big SUV like Toyota Land cruiser is very exciting. the expert drivers ,driver the SUV like you are in a Fighter Jet! after that you will go to a desert restaurant and can eat and drink and look to Arabic dance and other ceremonies. At the night you will return to your hotel.
Most fun. Desert safari made our dubai trip most wonderful and unforgettable experience. It was much adventure activity and enjoyed activity.

Bit average really. I found this pretty average really. If you like being in a convoy of 50 4WDs speeding up and down sand dunes. The dinner and dancing was nothing out of the ordinary - the food I tasted was what I've already had at any number of Arabic cafes/eateries in Sydney. And the same with the belly dancing - seen it all before any number of times in Sydney. No doubt that the drivers are very skillful. Over rated in my opinion
A Must do experience. To leave the city and experience the desert and watch the sun go down is simply breathtaking. A ride on a camel is the icing on the cake!
excellent. A very good for value experience-includes a buffet meal in an oasis desert camp along with belly dancing show
Desert Safari. It is a tour that should never be missed. Enjoy the sand dune bashing and camel rides with great barbeque food. With the night performers.

Trip of a lifetime. Shopped around but ended up booking with planet via concierge at Hilton hotel. The sand dunes are massive and never expected the cars to travel so fast over them. They do say there is always someone in the group that will be sick!! Thankfully not me. The cars take up to 6 people and the driver and they all travel in convoy expertly driven. You eventually arrive at a commercial Bedouin style camp where you can camel ride, have a fab BBQ help yourself to drinks ( alcohol you pay for tho) and get Henna tattoos watch Egyptian dancers, try Hubble bubble and there is also a gift shop. The trip cost around £40 pp and was money well spent. Didn't want the evening to end and if we go back we would pay extra for the option of camping overnight.. My 3 boys aged 9, 11 & 15 said it was the highlight of the holidays, and believe me we packed loads in!

4WD tour just awesome. I did this tour as part of an educational trip to Dubai in May 2012. Book early, it sells out. Meal was good at the end. I loved the 4WD part on the dunes. Things like that usually scare me a bit but I wished they had gone faster. Book it. Holding a falcon was a highlight. You can smoke shisha if you wish. You sit in the floor on cushions Bedouin style, so be aware of this if you have issues getting up and down and speak to your agent to see if there is any other seating option for you.

overhyped. Dubai Desert conservation reserve is a large tract of desert. Some Tour oprerators take you through this after Desert Safari on the way to camp. Does'nt have anything more to see than a few animals.
Desert Safari- a Great Experience. The dune bashing was amazing. Drivers are really experts. The capmsite experience was also great. It made our evening very entertaining.

our desert advantures. I excited wirth 4x4. we shouted allot. Me and my friend sometime laughed sometime afraid. and made a video with belly dancer. nice barbeque and with tatou henna design was unforgettable.
A great experience. Took in the Safari ride and barbeque - very well organised and the barbeque was a great experience. Food was just about acceptable !
Just amazing. We had a great time at the desert, fun off road desert ride. Watching the sunset, camel back ride, belly dancing, hubble-bubble, dinner.

Thrilling. Not recommended for the elderly or little kids but the dune bashing is brilliant, had a great time, the food is great too, the only thing is if you book with some tour operators you have to travel with others and at the end you have to wait around for them to get back to the jeep!

If you are visiting Dubai for the first time, This is a MUST!. I have been to dubai but never really had the opportunity to do this. Luckily this time I was in dubai for seven days and with family so we booked this trip. A few family friends that live in dubai also joined in and we booked the whole 4x4 SUV. There are many companies that offer this safari so someone's experience can be different from someone elses! My experience I would say was excellent! They first took us to some quad biking regions. Quad-biking was extra. We then got into our SUVs and all the SUVs from different hotels and locations got together at a meeting point. The fun started after that! They drove around the desert at really high speeds (dune driving)! It's like a roller-coaster ride except for it is real and there are no safety features. There have never been any injuries reported and the drivers are obviously experts. However I would not recommend this trip to people with hypertension or heart disease or anything that might cause them to feel sick due to this. For an average person, this is actually quite intense. We then stopped at a top of the desert to take pics of the perfect sunset. We get to a fort like location where we see and dine. There are many things there such as heena, camel rides, bbq and local and authentic foods, holding of eagles, shisha and and few other things. There is also Belly dancing and another dancer doing tricks. Food is included but alcohol is extra. There are tons of photographers there and unless you want to buy horrible (usually crooked) pictures at really high prices try not to let them take pictures of you. Some get really pissed off if you don't buy their pics. but in overall, it was an outstanding time out in the desert! I haven't met a single person that disliked this trip!

Amazing desert safari. Excellent value for money to see a breath taking environment, meet some camels, eat some typical arabic food and bash some dune's in 4x4's, I would definately recommend to anyone going to Dubai!

A fun Bedoin sampler. On a family vacation, we took the adventure trip to the DDCR. The first event was a falcon demonstration and explanation of the importance of falconry in the Bedoin culture. Next, we ventured on for a "dune bashing" adventure. Our guide did explain that it was a little less intense that an actual dune bashing as we were in a Land Cruiser and remained on a path. Plenty exciting, though. One vehicle actually got stuck in a dune. We stopped to watch the sunset over the sand which was very beautiful and great photo op. We then headed to the "oasis" for a grilled meal, henna painting, belly dancing, hooka and camel rides. Touristy, I'll grant you, but a very unique experience and it didn't feel like a tourist trap. This was the favorite event of our entire group, which included 4 teens.

Desert safari- visit Dubai conservation center!. Desert conservation center is must watch place in Dubai. A bit of sand-dune action in the 4WD followed by a visit to the Camel Farm and watching a stunning sunset. The experience was awesome and thrilling. We had enjoyed a dinner with belly dance and the other dances. All were excellent. It is recommendable to eat less food before going for desert safari as some might vomit during the bumpy ride in the desert.

Dune Bashing. No trip to Dubai is complete until u visit the DDCR, dune bashing is an exhilarating experience...apart from that you should try & hire the dune buggies...they are fun, don't forget to bargain prices.
Amazing. So much fun! Had a really great time. The leaders were also very pleasant.
Unforgettable safari. Spectacular ride through the sand dunes, camel ride and a superb outdoor diner and show.

I wish I had known about this!. I really really wish I had known about this before I went! I wanted to see the desert - and booked a desert safari - which was unbelievably tourist trap material. This is actually what I wanted to see!
Dunes wow. Desert of Dubai specialy desert drive is one of the best fun and i will must say amazing fun and a very lovely dessert drive
Amazing. we went to al maha desert resort a real treat just amazing
Interesting. If you happen to have time it is an interesting visit

Good for Thrillseekers. The four wheel ride was awesome, our tour was not well organised had to wait for long time in the bus for our turn. At the campsite it was the same, there was no one to guide us where to sit. The dinner was good, I felt sorry for the familes with children who had to wait for food. There was no system, survival of the fittest. The belly dance and the other dances was very good, including the ride back to the bus in the dark

Thrilling experience. Desert safari is one of the must watch place in dubai. The experience is awesome and thrilling. There was a dinner with belly dance and the other dances. All are excellent. we enjoyed a lot. Eat less food before going for desert safari as some might vomit during the bumpy ride in desert.

Great fun. The dune bashing is great fun- you need to be ready for a very bumpy and exciting ride. There is a barbecue offered, henna artist that seems over worked, belly dancing and you can go on quad bikes, ride a camel and sand board.
Desert safari a must ... You must go on the Desertsafari ...the 4 wheel drive experience is great ....the camp sites and belly dancing is awesome
amazing trip. The drivers are perfect. It was magic - the golden sands, the camel ride in the middle of the desert with great show and good barbeque dinner.
Excellent. Dinner and dances. we had camel rides and the safari rides in the desert. i hope to be there again some day.
Must be done. Personally I don't think Dubai is an interesting destination therefore a trip to the Desert is a must to admire one of nature's wonders.

sand bashing is cool!. sorry i don';t know what this "conservation reserve" is but i went to the desert safari trip, which wasn't listed here. the trip started at 3.30pm and ended at 9pm. i had a 4x4 driving crazy on the desert plus belly dance performance and riding a camel in a tourism village in the middle of the desert. like my friend said: this is a most valuable 50 dollars i ever spent!
Wonderful Horrible desert riding But very nice Trip. Desert safari on Land Rover is amazing experience,i recommend it *****

Not for the faint hearted. Dune bashing in 4/4 the drivers are very skilled - they make it look easy. My friends loved it but I was scared and held on for life. Once I relaxed it was good. Great to watch a sunset. Had a camel ride and the evening meal and entertainment was really really good. A must really. It's a chance to experience some real culture and wear traditional costume.

Terrific, dont do it if you have back or neck problem. The whole safari was great, great show at the end in the evening and the food was excellent given the mass production nature. We really enjoyed it. But please be aware that for an hour you are DUNE BUSTING, this basically involves a 4x4 (mainly Toyota Landcruiser) with 4 to 6 of you in it and a well trained driver attacking the dunes, we didnt roll, but we certainly slid sideways down a few, we didnt get air time as we smashed into them but we nearly did and yes the cruiser in front of us lost its bumper which apparently is common whilst another cruiser needed a shove to get it out of a sand trap. When asked the driver explained that these vehicles are generally dead after two years service, to be honest I am surprised they survive that long!
Nice evening. A great place, well organised, spent a nice night with a group of friends. The food was well served, lots of intertainments and fun.
Excellent Desert Safari. The original fantastic safari desert. There is nothing like it. The camels and the interesting Falcon show was brilliant.

Desert safari. Would like to comment on trip to Desert Safari. What an adventure!! Although with small kids & ladies with spondy problem, we opted for easier ride but even that was musch fun. The camp stay of two hours with Bar-be-que dinner with Arabic dance show was just great.

Good if you like sand. Excellent if you like sand, lots of sand! Very little wildlife to see either 4 legged or flying variety. The bst bit was you got to see the dessert "sensibly" with some off road fun, without being thrown about and scared witless on the main off road desert trips.

beautiful animals and a very good place too. The animals are well kept in here......orynx is a very beautiful animal too, it is just like a deer......other creatures which are here can only be found in Dubai i guess. overall it was quite beautiful experience

Desert Beauty. The Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve is, like everything else in Dubai, not quite real, but nonetheless a marvel. The Reserve was formerly the location of camel farmers whose animals stripped the desert of the little vegetation it had. Rescuers and conservationists chose to protect a small portion of the natural desert and planted and continue to water some 6,500 plants/trees/shrubs (thus not real) in order to sustain the introduction of herds of gazelle and the precious oryx (al maha) - once a native animal, then extinct in the wild, and now restored to its former lands. The desert portion and the surrounding dunes are wonderful in their natural state. While dune bashing is a huge tourist attraction, from my purist's standpoint it is an unwelcome addition to desert activities.

Great experience but somewhat cold. Beautifull part of the dessert. We camped during one of the coldest nights it seemed later ( around zero degrees).But what a stars on the not polluted by city lights sky

Amazing Desert experience. Good ride on the SUV. Dune bashing, Thrilling ride. Then saw the camel farms, Belly dancing and Quad biking. The desert in the night is pretty cold and perfect. I would certainly do it again, over and over again.
just as one would imagine. wonderful to see the sun going down and enjoying the quitness and peace that excudes from being in such a wonderful place.
holiday. watching the sun go down and camel riding wow and lovely meal in evening unforgettable
Desert Safari. Romance with sands. experience of 4X4 drive with sand dune bashing, romantic sunset and dine in desert with folk arabic dancers.

Wildlife in Desert.. It is indeed an unbelievable thing to prserve wildlife in this desert. Got the opportunity to see some black bucks. It is truely a marvellous endevour to maintain these wild life inside the desert.
People are employed only to take care of them. Really outstanding.
Serene. A desert on your doorstep and too such a beautiful one with wild animals and exotic plants, the drift and ripples in the snad dunes are out of 'Lawrence of Arabia'
Thrilling. Excellent safari with relaxing meal and shisha. Our driver Khalid provided an excellent service.

GREAT MOMENT IN THE DESERT. iT WAS BRILLIANT EVEN WITH OUR 2 LITTLE GIRLS 2.5 and 4,5 years old we all had a great racing moment in the dune, saw the red sands of the desert , ride camels, had some music, very nice meal in the middle of nowhere in the desert, and a nice dancing show and belly dancing. not to miss in Dubai PLEASE !!

Great experience. Desert safari is one of the most famous attraction in dubai. Can book a day in advance. Food is a bit problem for vegeterians as very less options are there. They have few stalls put up and belly dance show.

Breathtaking sand dunes. You need this if you just seen the skyscrapers in Dubai Marina. Such a different experience. The Oryxes, the small gazelles and the beautiful sand dunes. We had a perfect guide in Omar from Arabian Adventures.
